Review Text: Amos is one of the nicest housekeeping supervisor, very polite, professional and even communicated in my local language and very smart and quick in service as well. I wish you all the very best for your career. Thank you.

Sheraton Lagos has been the go to option for our company. The hotel is extremely old but is huge and gives you a sense of calm in the chaos of Lagos. The restaurant staff are quite accommodating and there is security on each floor. The tennis court is the best in entire Nigeria and the gym is well equipped.

Had to stay in this hotel for 4 hours as I had a long transit in Lagos. So the interest is to be able to rest. Checked in and had to pay for the room at check in. Ordered room service and then decided to have a quick sleep. I was awaken by a phone call from reception requesting me to pay for room service now as I was checking out in 2 hours. Then 30 minutes later, room service arrives with a credit card machine. All in all, I couldn’t rest which is the first purpose of taking a hotel room during transit. First time in my life I see such a behavior. If you want to rest or be shown respect, avoid this place.

Review Title: Suggest you prefer another hotel in Lagos
Review Text: The worst service ever not only in Africa, in the entire Sheraton or Marriot network. A simple food takes 1hrs to be delivered, sometimes even 90 minutes. And guess what, no one gives a damn about it, funniest part is they charge 40$ for a burger which arrives after 90 mnts

Had read a few negative reviews of this hotel. You are all wrong! I am coming towards the end of a 5 day business trip here and I cannot recommend this place highly enough. Every member of staff has been so very kind and helpful to me - EVERY one. Had lunchtime meeting poolside yesterday and was looked after by Victoria and Sonia - two marvellous women who couldn’t do enough for myself and my guests. I’m in Lagos quite a lot and this is my new home.

Back again to the Lagos Sheraton after trying the Radisson Blu for a couple of stays. Same old problems have returned - with no adjoining rooms despite requesting them during the booking process. Reception say that they can't guarantee adjoining rooms - which doesn't make sense when you are staying with two children under the age of 12. The suggestion that 'they will be alright' isn't reassuring after a long and tiring flight. We don't want an upgrade, we don't want a fruit basket (?!), we don't want two rooms vaguely close to one another - we just want an adjoining room when it's been requested in the booking. As one of the recent comments below states, the hotel does appear to have taken a slide. There is a damp odour along the 4th floor corridor. The rooms are old, crumbling
Room Tips: Arriving at the hotel after 6pm seems to result in them giving the adjoining rooms away to other...

Review Text: Pity, standards have drastically dropped at this hotel and the rates charged per night is not justified. Is it the stale stench eminating from the carpets, or the crumbling ceiling tiles in the room held up only by glue & paint, or is it the distain the reception supervisor showed for a points paying guest. Things are not right anymore at this hotel.

Review Title: OK and Close to the Airport, but could be More
Review Text: The stay was generally ok. Nothing exciting to note, except that we came to have a restful stopover weekend but it was far from it. The noise from the music filtered into the rooms very freely even though we were on the 4th floor. The room we were given was next to the staff exit door and every time the door was opened and trolleys wheeled in it would seem as though someone was trying to open our door. The main plus will be the proximity of the hotel to the airport which made it easy to avoid much of the traffic and have a quick check in.
Room Tips: if you are looking to rest avoid Friday Nights, they have an event where there is noisy music...

Review Text: Excellent is all I can say about sheraton Lagos. I enjoyed my stay.  When I checked in, it was a night and I felt like changing my room because of the water drops from the AC. On my way back to the lobby I met one of the supervisor "Amos" I explained to him and  he followed up to ensure it was fixed. Very well spoken, super friendly and very helpful, I disturb him with many request which they delivered very fast 😃.   Sheraton has excellent staffs front desk, restaurant staffs and housekeepers.

Considering the number of reviews here that are less than enthusiastic,  I was pleasantly surprised by what an enjoyable stay I had, due in large part to the warmth and sincerity of my interactions with most of the staff. It was nice to see they treated one another with the same level of respect.  The shower water was lukewarm the first day, but this was corrected the next day without my needing to complain. The club level room was comfortable and had everything I needed.   There was a decent variety of options at the breakfast buffet.
Review Text

The hotel is OK. Not that great compared to other Sheraton Hotels I have been to in the world. This one is Very Very Safe in Nigeria. I noticed the staff are superb. Nigerian staffs at the hotel are very well spoken, super friendly and very helpful. This makes up for everything else. I could come back here over and over again just because of them.

friendly staff but there are several improvements that need to be seen from various angles.  1) the condition of the room with some scratches and worn furniture. the water from the faucet also looks unclean and safe to use.  2) breakfast with a charge rate of usd26 and a buffet that only serves the majority of empty glass noodle and fried rice without egg and meet inside plus most of other food is just potato and soup is not worth the price charged.  housekeeping team and other staff are the best. always greeting guests and also helping with any questions asked

Top notch service and attention to detail. I liked the gym and pool to relax after work and the choice of food in the restaurants is really impressive. Over a few weeks I had all very good meals. Rooms were comfortable clean and quiet. Thanks to the GM for taking extra steps to make the stay a pleasure here.

Extremely rude waitress attended me. First of all the price of food in this hotel is ridiculously expensive for example for a burger you need to pay 35$.  After waiting for almost 2 hours they brought my order and the food was uncooked and cold.   The customer service in this hotel is just terrible.

The location is good . The people are very good very polite and willing to help you always with a smile. Very professional  Rooms are very old very noisy (you can hear the next room very clearly ) and not so cleaned. Beds (mattress is a disaster) Internet connection is very very bad. Next time we will try some one else  Unacceptable for Sheraton hotel .

The security team at this hotel was very hostile to my partner. My partner was treated with such disrespect. If you intend to have your loved ones over, I do not recommend this hotel. Terrible service. I am never going back there.

I did not like the hotel at all.. especially the food it was expensive for nothing. i order a beef burger with cheese. The cheese was not good at all, I mean the brand… it was not fresh and it was smelling very very bad. I want to vomit .I’m extremely disappointed.

During check-in the receptionist told us that a person can invite one guest to the lounge. When we actually came to the lounge, and had already settled down, Mr. Dammy (or Demmy) came and said we were not allowed in here. What communication you have in the hotel... Your staff put me in such an embarrassing situation. And what's more, when I tried three times to explain myself, not even once Mr. Dammy let me finish talking. He kept interrupting and saying that he will charge us. But no one refused to pay, we only tried several times to explain ourselves, what we've been told at the reception.  After we signed the bills, and thought "ok, now we can enjoy the lounge", the staff started showing his "selective respect". He collected dirty plates and empty bottles from other people,

Review Title: The worst hotel to be in
Review Text: This hotel staff are extremely unprofessional, their customer service is very poor.  The location of the hotel is pretty weird, oh plus the housekeeping staff are loud so don’t expect to have a good night or day sleep without disturbance.  I do not recommend this at all

Arrived exhausted to the hotel after a long travelling day at 15:20 , and I am wiring the review now at 18:00 still waiting for my room , all airlines crew and VIP got their room and I am still waiting , the receptionist keep telling few minutes and after 3 hours still waiting … asked for the supervisor and I got the same response few minutes … what a service !!!!
Review Text

Dinner was Lagos Sheraton on Tuesday 27th August 2021 was a dismal experience except for the company of my dinner companions. There were three birthday parties and the nose from each party was at a record high. That is understandable anyway.   The sour point of the evening was when we had to pay for dinner. There was only one option of payment which was cash. POS machines were not working. The ATM machines in the lobby were non-functional. I guess internet service is largely responsible for that.   Then Sekinat's surly attitude as well as her immediate boss in the Accounts Office left a lot to be desired.   I will certainly not be returning to Sheraton Lagos Hotel in a long time.   Customer service is of utmost importance.

Dear Tripadvisors, I traveled to Nigeria almost 6 days ago, and have been stayed in this Hotel since that day. To reach a dinning services, you should spend min. 5-6 minutes, if you are lucky. Phone is ringing during this time but no one responses. If you have enough patience, someone pick the call but not talk with you directly. You should try to communicate with them even after the picking up the call.  After this step, if you will succeed to give your order, you should wait min. 1-2 hours for the delivery. Unfortunately, this is not limited with this. When they deliver your order after 1-2 hours later, you will be surprised with the coming. Its either missing - different items or cold.  I tried to reach hotel management. But unfortunately in all of my attempts, I could not

Review Title: Decent stay, banquet food needs improvement though
Review Text: Stayed here for a week and also organized a workshop at the same  venue.  Pros : The rooms were decent and comfortable , my room had a water issue and I was given another room immediately.  Breakfast buffet had  variety both international and local cuisines were available. Staff were pleasant and willing to help out. Conference staff went above and beyond to ensure we had a smooth workshop special mention to Bobby . Cons; There is a need to upgrade the conference facilities especially the projectors, which kept on giving us issues through our workshop. Lunch served at the banquet hall needs improvement.  There is need to have clear communication to guests at check in on hotel procedures and practice. We had a participant whose  bills were posted to our organizations account in

I’m a elite Bonvoy member so I was upgraded to the club level. I was here for a few weeks and enjoyed my stay.   First, the great parts of my stay. The staff in the club lounge, especially Goke, made me feel welcome and they took great care of me. Besides the service, I really loved the coffee machine. Anyone who spends time in Nigeria knows the coffee in most places is instant. The lounge has a coffee machine that makes fresh espresso, cappuccino, whatever you want and I really enjoyed it. The internet in the hotel was the best I have experienced in Nigeria, with fast and reliable connections.   Next the good. The lounge is on the smaller side (it gets pretty full during evening happy hours), but is pretty well stocked for breakfast or evening happy hours. The food selection in

I had the pleasure of staying at the Sheraton hotel Ikeja, Lagos and I’ll like to start by giving a special shout-out to the staffs at the Lagos hotel, they are operating at high levels of excellence.   If you’re ever in Lagos, I will strongly recommend that you stay with them and upgrade to the club floor. It’s worth it!   There was an incident during my stay and Mr. Patrick (head of security) handled it exceptionally. I want to give special shout outs to a few staff members that really went above and beyond to make my stay memorable.   John (Namkere), Saheed, Dabiri, Nathaniel, Blessing, Theo, Bisi, Taiwo, Tosin, Mary, Winifred, Efe, Goke and the entire front desk and room service  staffs. These are just a few names I can remember but I do appreciate all of you!   Kemi

Clean and spacious rooms, no insects inside (very important when you’re in Africa, since outdoor I was almost eaten alive by mosquitos). Buffet breakfast and dinner is good for any taste, local dishes and international choices plus my favorite salmon for breakfast. Alcoholic beverages are not included in buffet, but with help of staff you can get it from the pool bar outside. Pool is big enough for swimming, but be careful and use a lot of sunscreen

Had a 4 day stay at this hotel which I thoroughly enjoyed.   The rooms are a little dated and small, but the hotel has a good gym, a first class pool and a great breakfast. The Club Lounge is small, but has everything you need.  The annoying part of my stay was the keys cards didnt work most of the time. I made so many trips to reception to get them working. Still, not a biggie.  Ose in the restaurant was the standout member of staff. She had a friendly smile and was always busy. She really did enhance my stay.  Also need to mention Friday, the doorman on the elevators. Great attitude , great guy, well done.  Yes, I would stay again.

At breakfast I was greeted by Gift. She was polite, genuine and happy. A real delight to have her serve me. She offered all the breakfast options and I ended up eating more than I needed as she was so encouraging. Also Lydia served us and she too was delightful.

Review Title: Mone Has Been stolen from my card there
Review Text: Horrible hotel and horrible Staff. Money Has Been stolen from my card in this hotel(in front reception desk) after two weeks since I left the hotel. Despite the fact hotel admitted that they have taken the money, they have not give it back. No replied for my e-mails...just pathetic.  Be carefull with card payment !

Switched to this hotel because it's close to the airport. On arrival in the hotel around 8 pm my room was not available yet. Got offered a beverage in the bar and about an hour later the room was ready. As a compensation I was offered an upgrade. Room was very nice. Later that week, after an inland trip, I checked in at the same hotel again. This time no upgrade, and I noticed the difference. ;-) The hotel has some shops, restaurant, bar...
Review Text

Review Title: Worst Credit Department / Customer Service Treatment Ever!
Review Text: Well, on February 7 I used my Debit Card to check out of the hotel using a Pre Auth Form, the amount was put on hold, and not deducted, until the company transferred the amount to the hotel.  The company settled the payment on February 19; however, for some reason the credit department cannot allocate the payment! Does that even sound logic? According to them, the person handling the case was on leave, so they don’t know where he left things, and are asking us for a proof of payment, while the payment was made online, via their payment link!!! So how can’t they allocate the payment?!  The company’s owner had to request a bank statement, which takes another week to issue, and sent them all the details via email, and they did not answer us and did not remove the hold from my card.

Review Title: Improved a lot but still disappointing for the price asked
Review Text: The staff improved a lot over the last years: they’re much more pleasant, polite and efficient.  The room is clean, the bathroom is clean too, as well as the hotel in general, even if the corridors smell “old”; which can have its charm.  However, I used the app to request for extra things and they were not all provided. Sleepers were not there, nor the comb or the dental and shaving kits.  The food still needs to be watched: beetroot at the 1st breakfast were spoiled and sour already.  Pineapple juice on day 2 was also spoiled and turned, becoming sour and bubbly. I’ve however been explained that it was not the juice that was rotten, but one of the fruits used to make it...  The hairdryer is so dirty that it sticks to the hand.  The A/C is very efficient and quiet,  it the rooms

I have stayed several times in this hotel; but this time I was staying for 1.5 months. This is enough time to witness and experience almost everything that a hotel has to offer. The staff altogether tries hard to make your stay comfortable. The Club Lounge Manager and reception takes good care of everything. The executive lounge on the 6 floor, has an okay selection of food and beverages from 5 to 7 PM. The food at this hotel is also good and a must try is the Italian Restaurant on the ground floor.

We transited through the Sheraton Lagos hotel on return to Nigeria and it was still as nice as ever.  The hotel is not a new hotel so expect some rooms to have dated equipment and amenities. I'd advise you stay in the higher floors as these are a bit improved.  Check in was swift and security was alright. We were offered a fruit platter as a welcome gift and the kids got toys for the season.  Room service was also efficient as we didn't have to wait more than necessary. I discovered if you have need for assistance with your luggage, you better go downstairs yourself as it might take a while before a porter comes up for your bags.   We left our baby stroller in the hotel and on our return, it was delivered back to our room just as we left it. This is commendable!  Overall, I'd

Mr Nathaniel and his staff at the Sheraton, Lagos are getting better and better with each of our stays. We had flown from New Zealand via Australia and South Africa and were understandably very tired when we checked in. Mr Nathaniel saw this and ensured that his staff knew to make our check in as prompt and painless as possible. Our two young children were fast asleep and were placed in a chair at the side, whilst this process was going on. Our luggage was left in the store as we wouldn't be needing it until we checked out. All these small touches are valued and create a better customer experience. I hope we see even further improvements on our next visit.

Review Title: comfortable but be careful to the noise
Review Text: nice staff, comfortable rooms, good buffet for the breakfast with good choices of african food. It would be just better if the cleaning staff was careful with the noise while cleaning the rooms, until 9:30 (they just have to use the card key to close the doors !)

Security to get in to the hotel is safe, cars are seached before entering the compound. Armed guards are stationed outside the hotel within the grounds. Check in is easy, quick and efficient. The rooms are large, comfortable, recently decorated, and clean. The bed is excellent. In the room there is a fridge, a safe, iron and ironing board. Large TV and working desk, with water provided and the usual tea and coffee.  The internet is fast and reliable, I was able to watch Netflix.  Room service is good, although not quick!   There is several bars, and a casino on site, all seemed busy with a mix of guests.   The breakfast is excellent.   I will stay here again.

very bad experience in Lagos! arrived at the reception at check-in at 7 PM, long time for check-in (20 Min) ; my room ( and my colleagues' room) was (were) not ready! obliged to wait more than 1 hour in the lobby ( a drink offered ...) . Finally get my room at 8h30 PM. didn't want to extend tthe check out time the next day for free , obliged to leave the room before 12PM.  The room is old as well as the general shape of the hotel . We are very far from the Sheraton standarts , and very far from a 4 stars , specifically for that price . I will avoid the hotel for sure .

Review Title: Wonderful stay in Lagos, amazing staff
Review Text: I've stayed at the Sheraton in Ikeja twice and will be back again next week. My last stay was for 8 nights and I was incredibly well looked after by Mr. Matthew Agboola. Matthew, thank you for everything. First, the hotel has a great location - close to the airport. The buffet breakfast is fantastic and served in a sunny room, but it's the breezy outdoor restaurant/bar I like the best. It's a perfect place to catch up on emails or have a light dinner at the end of the day. The buffet lunch was suitable for entertaining clients and the exec lounge provided a quiet place for a coffee and a quick meeting. Really, though, it's the team that make this my home away from home in Lagos. When I was delayed in traffic getting to a lunch meeting, Matthew made sure that my guests were made

Unfortunately a story of two halves. Room not ready on arrival with no explanation of renumeration. Not even the offer of a free beer. Reception staff un friendly and unhelpful. Same in the pool area. No offer of bed chair mattress unless you looked good. Mmmmm. Tennis coach friendly and helpful. As was the restaurant staff.
Review Text

I was at Sheraton hotel Ikeja for a business summit. The environment was antic yet neat. Generally found it appealing but didn't like the rest room on the ground floor. Didn't appear fresh as I would have expected of a hotel of this class

A very homely place and close to the airport. You could stroll within or outside the premises. Feels like home and very safe.  It is more like a business than leisure hotel but it fits for both. Pretty old (more like vintage) and urgently needs renovation.

Review Title: Far away from home but still feeling home
Review Text: Dear Sheraton accept my congratulations on you Hotel.  I come on a monthly basis to Sheraton Lagos basically for work and besides some problem to the room which are a bit dated I’m always happy to come as the stuff is like a Family! I would like to personally thanks Mr Goke Mr. Aondover Ms Helen and Mr Obesi aka Felix. This guys are a unique asset of your hotel and deserve a management position for my knowledge. They put passion Hard hours of work smile and kindness into their Job and this is something they have to teach to hospitality new generations!  Great staying again.

Review Title: Excellent stay with in-room dining serving European dishes.
Review Text: The location is no doubt second to none. Accommodation you can't complaint about but the most unique part was excellent and I mean really excellent European cuisine served in the in-room dining menu. For business travellers this Sheraton is the one of the best choice in Lagos.

They have a good Italian Restaurant and a good Pool Bar with a nice selection of food. Make your own pizza is good and have tried couple of times. When it comes to the room, they need to do more for cleaning. I was not impressed with the mops used to clean the floor, they look old and dirty but somehow the floor looks neat. Don't stay on a Friday and Saturday night with a room facing the pool bar. The have live music every Friday night and often parties on Saturday Evening. The music is loud and late. Not a good option if you need to catch a flight in the morning or just need a good night sleep.

The Sheraton Hotel is convenient to the airport but the hotel is also showing its age. Perhaps some rooms have been updated, but others are overdue as are the public areas. The food in the restaurants is excellent, although a bit overpriced. The front-desk staff is friendly and helpful. The Sheraton has a “Green Choice” program that provides rewards for NOT having your room cleaned on any day(s) that you choose. This is a commendable option and is intended to reduce the cleaning’s impact on the environment, such as reduced consumption of water. In contrast, the hotel engages in a policy that has just the opposite but harmful environmental effects. The hotel uses single-use plastic bags to collect laundry, which I had done. When the laundry (one shirt, two sets of underwear, and

Review Title: Worst hotel I have stayed in a decade
Review Text: The hotel is very old and in a terrible shape. Rooms are not clean and stinking. A very strong odor of humidity which will make you sick. I saw 3 rooms of so called superior category and finally decided to pay for an upgrade to club floor at least to get some sleep for that night. I will never ever come back to this hotel.

I found this in better shape than I'd expected. The company behind it has been through lots of publicly known issues, and management had suffered. But looks like they have new management, and there's been some refurbishment work. All in all, not a bad stay at all

Review Title: Elizabeth and her team are superstars
Review Text: Was there for a few nights for business, we had booked 5 rooms. Severe rain cancelled my meetings on the last day and Elizabeth (always has a smile) offered me late checkout after finding out I had a late evening flight. Will deffo be back end of July and make sure my company always books this hotel. Rejjie Ahmed

I happen to go to the ladies toilet.  Very disappointing for a sheraton hotel. So unkept. I didn't notice if there was a rooster for cleaners at all. The lobby appeared clean and presentable. Unkept toilet drops the image
Review Text

I have stayed here many times over the last 5 years. My most recent stay in June was for 5 nights and food, service, staff was all exceptional. They have a great band outside on a friday night too at the pool bar. A few staff were particularly attentive including Ibrahim who did an amazing job cleaning my room and ensured everything was done to perfection. Thanks to Friday at the pool bar for running a great bar. And Damilola B for great service. Thanks to Goke and Lynda in the lounge for looking after me at breakfast. As always Margaret George ensures all guests are all well looked after. I will return again and look forward to being taken care of at Sheraton Ikeja.

whole environment is good, near to a big grass and forest area, and swimming pool also well enough, 2 security check points make it safely, this place is just like a Oasis of lagos if you have seen environment outside

Review Title: Good Hotel and Safe location in Lagos
Review Text: First time in Nigeria and the hotel met my expectations. Clean rooms and friendly staff. The best paart is the restaruant choices that you have at the hotel are quite good with good food and nice atmosphere. I definitely recommend the outdoor restaurant by the pool side. For breakfast the buffet bar is good but crowded so if you can enjoy the amenities of the club floor level 6 is best. Quiet and private and easy to access from your room.

I stayed in this hotel this week. The hotel is very very good, have spacious rooms. There are many food choices and it has fantastic bar. The staff is very friendly but as this is high risk country so sometimes there is lot of procedures followed. Overall very good hotel. I really enjoyed the stay here.

Review Title: Old dated rooms and mouldy bathrooms!
Review Text: I had a room on the second floor of this hotel. The rooms are dark with a very cheap laminate mock wood floors which has gaps in it everywhere. The furniture is very dated and scuffed and chipped. The overall decor of the room was bad. The cleanliness of the room was also suspect. There is tea and coffee making facilities in the room. The flat screen tv was of a good size with some good channels. Now the bathroom is like a relic from the 70’s! Very old bath, sink, toilet with 1970’s tiles. The bath has mould everywhere. The hotel soaps were a cheap non branded product. The bathroom cleanliness was not good at all with all sorts of hairs in the corners  of the rooms and a brown stained toilet. I would not rain this hotel above 2*.

Recently stayed in the Sheraton, Ikeja for the first time for 20 nights in a standard room on business. The reception area was very large and appeared to be a bright modern space which gave me hope that the rooms would not be the same mediocre standard that has come to be my usual experience in many hotels in Lagos that bill themselves as 'luxury'. Such hotels may, at some point in the distant past been able to claim such status but due to years of poor / no maintenance and refurbishment now would struggle to achieve 3 stars in the UK. Unfortunately the Sheraton also fell into this category of hotel for me. My room (see photos) had an extremely depressing outlook and inside was not much better. The very dated bathroom had mould around the bath and the tiles and the general

My room on the 5th floor was modernised and very comfortable, a huge bed and quiet floor gave me that important well rested feeling. the bathroom contains only a shower, but this was very luxurious with a seat and either rain head or more powerful side spray. Good quality toiletries are also supplied as well as a comfortable robe to change into. Plenty of free tea and coffee in the room and a good supply of electrical sockets for the business traveller to recharge the necessary devices. Front staff and indeed everyone I met were charming and a credit to the hotel. A little more attention to detail is required my coffee cup was chipped, but that's about all I could say needed to improve, a great stay thank you.

It might not be the most modern but this really is a great hotel. Rooms are very clean and comfortable, friendly staff, nice outdoor bar/eating area close to the pool. Good wifi throughout. We experienced the Friday night party which is a great time! Lots of local(ish) music and dancing - worth going to if you can. The food and breakfast were very good and service was professional. As mentioned, it may not be brand new but I really think that give it some character and charm. It's not the cheapest by a long way, but you get what you pay for.

Review Title: A Pleasant Surprise - keeping in mind the Nigerian Factor
Review Text: Visited this hotel some 15 years ago and I must say it has indeed stepped up its game since then. The staff was very polite and welcoming - a refreshing cold drink at the reception desk. The porter was friendly and most helpful in giving additional information on any requests I may have. The room was big enough - king size bed, the decor is spartan and what is there is def dated. Grouting in the bathroom needs retouching. Was given complimentary bottles of water, and a small bottle of Merlot. The fridge was not working and housekeeping rectified this immediately. Request for bathrobe and slippers was also promptly fulfilled, with apologies for the oversight. My stay was short and without any glitches. Wifi was super good, no power cuts, running water: hot and cold. Could really

Good hotel for business visitors, stayed on executive floor so had access to the lounge on that floor, so I cannot comment on the other restaurant, I used the pool bar for food at night or room service, food was tasty enough and no complaints. Room was fine nice and clean and shower was good with no issues. Hotel a bit worn in places but not too bad like anything it’s obviously an ongoing project.
Review Text

The rooms are quite spacious and comfortable. Wifi works with absolutely no glitches. Breakfast spread is quite good with options for vegetarians. Staff is courteous and service is prompt. Stay with complete peace of mind!

-front desk is not kind  -only two floors are remodeled -first room’s AC didn’t work  -whenever someone in your hallway’s door closes, your whole room shakes  -no one in the hotel has any problem solving skills. If they are confronted with an issue, they are paralyzed and you have to jump through 18 hoops in order to solve said problem. Extreme inconvenience when you are paying for “luxury.”

Review Title: One of the best in Lagos
Review Text: It is one of the oldest and best in Lagos. Its near the airport, Ikeja downtown is close. If you have to go to Victoria island it is a bit far with the traffic which will happen daily. The traffic is really bad so have to be sure where the work is.

I have been here 3years ago, you changed a lot, but one thing constantly being just amazing it's your staff, they are super friendly, naturally kind and helpful. They are making lovely atmosphere, especially Mrs Gift, from the Pumpkin leaf restaurant. She is very attentiv, she is paying attention even on the smallest details. I really enjoyed her service and hospitality. I would like to mention as well guys from the gym, thank you Philip for the great tennis class.

Review Title: EXCELLENT HOTEL! GREAT STAFF, best place to stay in Lagos!
Review Text: LOCATION The hotel is one of the closest international brandEd hotels to the main airport in Lagos and is therefore most popular with airline staff and expatriates and visitors generally. It is a mere 15 minutes drive from the airport, an Uber costs N4000 (about $10). I arrived at 8pm after a stressful two and a half hours drive to the hotel which is a mere 12km drive from the airport - a testament to the dire Lagos traffic situation. Temperature is about 30 degrees so it’s hot and when it rains it drenched you to soaking wet in seconds!  PARKING There is free parking on the premises and the hotel grounds are serene and secure. There is a thorough security check at the main gate of all cars driving in (of both the front bonnet and back boot of the car) and  All bags and personal

I ve been coming to Sheraton irregularly for a few years now, but one constant is the kindness of the staff, quality of the food and particularly at Pumpkin Leaf restaurant.  Food choice is mostly international with the standard choices but they also have a local food section with few dishes that is delicious in my taste. Hot and spicy adept you will be in for a treat.  The buffet breakfast is excellent tough a bit pricey but the excellent staff here make it worth while. A special mention to Mrs GIFT who is always pro active and attentive to her customers need. From her smile and warm welcome to her kindness and approachability.  I also want to mention Mrs Lydia who is also very attentive and a pleasure to meet each time.  Looking forward for my next visit to enjoy the food here

Definitely an experience to avoid.The only thing it has going for it is that it is close to the hotel. The hotel is old and poorly maintained.Bathrooms are in need of a good scrub.The room smells of disinfectant and the food options were really poor.I had dinner at the Italian restaurant who served up what looked like boiled vegetables with blocks of cheese as minestrone soup! Not again.

Review Title: Slow service in the Restaurants, solid hotel
Review Text: The hotel side is well operated, clean and friendly. I guess due to the many functions the Lobby Bar and Lounge is too busy for one to expect prompt service. I will be happy to try another time, the food was affordable and tasty .. Maybe when the place is less busy I will give it another point.

I stayed at the Sheraton Ikeja for 10 nights, and was overwhelmed by the service levels and staff culture- clearly cascading from the top down. Nothing was too much trouble and any issues were resolved with a smile within minutes. Congratulations to the MD, my namesake Barry, for his leadership. After many visits to Victoria Island hotels, this was my first ‘mainland’ stay in Ikeja. The facility is clearly an older structure, however the rooms have been refurbished, the main restaurant is good (outstanding breakfasts and impeccable service), the pool wonderful and the gym as good as any Marriot in the USA. I miss the warm service and smiling faces already. Photo is with James, the superb breakfast service manager.

Probably the most inviting, well maintained and top-notch hotel in Nigeria. The staff is very professional, courteous, responsive and responsible. I truly enjoy my stay whenever I stay at the Sheraton
Review Text

Horrible rooms, worse than a 1 star truck relay in Europe, while you pay more than $200 a night !  Rooms are old, small, with crappy acoustic proofing. Staff is not unfriendly but it's very hard to get a smile from them. Bar is full of hookers.  Food choice is ridiculously small. Food is spicy like hell.  Hotel doesn't accept local currency.

Enjoyed a relaxing time, favourite part of my stay was the excecutive lounge on the sixth floor right opposite my room. A quiet place to relax away from my room.  Thanks to all staffs on the sixth floor, to Funke, Mary and Mercy thanks for a beautiful service 👏🏻👍🏽. Glad to have met the charming and very professional IT guy too. Hope to see you all soon.  Thanks to ladies in the saloon, pedicure was done to perfection.   If you are a big eater you are in for a treat.

A hotel located not to far from the airport. First impression is, well managed hotel with welcoming service during check in process. The hotel lobby is large with a bar and comfortable seating. During my visit was a giant X-mass tree located in the lobby, nice. The corridors are monitored 24/7 with personnel and the room are quite and with excellent comfort. The breakfast buffet was generous and you can order pancake or any other egg dish from the chef.  I would recommend the hotel if you need a place close to airport.

Nice hotel but The new section is better than old part of hotel. The buffet for dinner is nice and they have Shisha too. Staff are friendly. The internet is horrible though and electricity keeps fluctuating. We got stuck in elevator once for that.

Great place still! Perhaps this is the oldest place you can still rate excellent!  Good food, drinks and atmosphere.  First time I came here I was 11, glad it's still here! The greenery by the pool bar is awesome. Maybe they can try a DJ instead of live music on Fridays?

Review Title: Understanding the concept of an oasis
Review Text: The Sheraton literally is a relief from the stress of managing the daily hassle in Lagos from the incredibly horrific traffic (took me one day an hour to go 2 kilometers!), frequent power outages, and lack of infrastructure in this city of more than 20 million people. Here you can find a couple of good bars, a good meal, and a quality hotel environment. But, care is still required. Ate a salad here that resulted in a four day bout of food poisoning. The staff is friendly, but lacking in some of the finer customer service skills. Overall, this a more than acceptable place to stay.

Review Title: A good refuge in the bustle of Lagos
Review Text: This is apparently one of the oldest hotels in Lagos but because of this really knows it's audience. It's big and busy, but in a good vibrant way. Rooms are spacious and the beds are very good.  Staff are generally friendly, welcoming and helpful.  With the exception of some variable service levels around the popular outdoor bar and restaurant.  This outdoor area is a winning feature,  providing a relaxed space to feel the tropical climate in relative comfort.  The breakfast (indoors) is very good but overpriced.   Requesting the top floors buys you an upgrade for a more luxurious and exclusive stay.

Review Title: Best hotel close to Lagos Airport
Review Text: Helpful staff, good choice of dining including by the pool bar, tennis court, gift shop, ATM, bank & mobile phone service providers all on site. Very secure. Most rooms now modernised to high standard. Close to airport.

Amazingly friendly& polite.I have been to alot of places but this service is professional, knowledgeable,helpful & just out of this world.Its a service to record as exemplary for training other staffs

Loved everything about this hotel from its secured location, friendly & accommodating staff to its restaurant, which offers both international and local cuisine. A 15 min drive from the airport, transportation to and from can be arranged for an additional cost.  There are also several businesses nearby from banks to cell phone providers for those conducting business so location is key. It has a pool, gym and bar area and breakfast is inclusive in their rate. There is a safe in the room and the typical amenities one finds at Sheraton chains worldwide. Certainly recommended!
Review Text

I have stayed here twice, for a short stay each time. The staff were competent and very hospitable.   The amenities were fine, and I really appreciated the quiet room.  The breakfast bar was nice - lots of options, and friendly service. I used room service for dinner a few times, and that was a good choice after a long and tiring day.  The hotel is one of the closest hotels to the airport, I think - and given the astoundingly heavy traffic in the area sometimes, it was good to be staying so close.   Overall, I'd stay here again.

Stayed here a few times this year with business travel. staff always friendly and helpful on the door and reception.  They have miss placed my booking a couple of times  but  a quick chat with the lady on the desk next to the shop and all was resolved.  Rooms are clean and the beds very comfortable.  Restaurants are ok, the main buffet has a good choice and is always well cooked.  The Italian does the best meatball in sauce and I would just eat bowls and bowls of them if I could, a perfect starter.  Avoid having a pizza if possible as they are never cooked in the center and had to send it back twice.  The base was just uncooked dough.   That's the only fault the pizza.

My first exposure to Nigeria. Excellent security (metal detector at the door, and guards on each floor by the elevator). The breakfast was great. They had a number of Western and local options. The pool look great, but I didn’t have he chance to try it.

Review Title: Oasis of Peace with good restaurants
Review Text: Highly recommended for someone on a business trip to Lagos. Facility is very good. They have a pool bar type restaurant where one can enjoy a drink and have a meal or snack. Inside there is an Italian restaurant that has excellent pastas. There is a small vegetable garden behind the hotel building where they grow basil and mint. Behind the hotel is also Gym, tennis courts and a jogging trail. The jogging trail needs some clean up. There is a executive lounge that can be a bit crowded in the evening. I am glad to have stayed here.

Review Title: Nice pool but gym let down by  Techno Gym gear  not serviced😢
Review Text: Nice hotel and pool for kids when a flight gets cancelled. Just sad world class managed hotel has gym but 2 of 3 running machines down and lose cables on exercise bikes. Seems simple management to arrange service engineer  from Abuja to come lagos......simple things make happy guests.

Review Title: nice place to hang out for lovers of nature, good music and artifacts .
Review Text: nice place to stay for both relaxation and business , close to both international and domestic airport . almost everything you need in an hotel is within or beside the hotel. verities of restaurant . fastest internet service  and also a functioning link at Sheraton at the lobby.

This is a very nice hotel in Lagos, the food is very good, with grill on Saturday, Monday and Wednesday. The pool bar area is very nice, the atmosphere, food and service It is very clean, service is so friendly.. I loved it

Have stayed over at this establishment a number of times.  During the most recent visit was pleasantly surprised to notice improved maintenance of premises.  More importantly, check-in smooth, bags to room and ac in good working order. Staff disposition and attitude certainly an asset to the hotel.   Had occasion to be there during world up events. A novel approach by management in providing intro, intermission & exit music by a "dj"   Regretfully the week's Wazobia night" was washed out by rain  - customers hung around but rain persisted. Management, how about a modest canopy to house the performers in the rainy season? Just a thought.  Breakfast on point.  Will consider returning "price dependent"

Review Title: Poor quality rooms but good service
Review Text: The bedrooms look at least ten years overdue on refurbishment - bathroom in particular is poor, with dirty curtains around bath-shower, cracked tiles etc. Air con is noisy and ineffective. I had a room on second floor above outside bar - avoid rooms with this aspect at all costs because the loud voices that continued past midnight were as clear in my bedroom as if I'd been in the bar.   Communal areas are better and the food is good. Service and security are both very attentive.   It was a shame the gym was closed but at least it is being upgraded.    Overall it wouldn't take much to improve the hotel but investment is way overdue.

The food is excellent although very pricey so you had better be corporate. Security is second to none and the airlines stay there to brighten up the place in the evening. The bar is just a meeting place for ladies of the night.
Review Text

It is great to return to this hotel after a year away for business. Although it's quite an outdated hotel, it can make good use of a revamp but I would still applaud the in-room dining and d service by their room service staff for consistently delivering their best.  Portions of the food is always a lot, like 2 to 3 times more than a normal portion in Europe, for example. The quality is just as equally good, I like especially their pastas n pizzas, and I certainly love their local cuisine, my favourite is the chicken stew with jollof rice and fried plantains. Just take note that the stews are fiery spicy, however you just feel like eating more and more because it's delicious!  The room service staff was very courteous and hospitable. Though I apologise I was not able to catch

I think this is one of the oldest hotels in Ikeja, and rooms refeclt perfectly the age. I didn't like the room very much even if it was clean. Services and facilities of the hotel are anyway good. Quite close to the Lagos international airport. Security is quite good.

This hotel is located about 25mins (no traffic) from the airport. Lots of local bars, restaurants & clubs are in the area. The hotel was very accommodating to our needs but my biggest issue with this hotel is the lighting in the rooms & the bathrooms. Shower curtain had mold on it & the countertop needs to be repainted. The pool area is nice & relaxing & there’s more than enough security on site. I wouldn’t stay here again as there are other areas of Lagos that offer more variety.

We planned a seminar here for our customers and I decided to book the same venue for my 3 expatriate friends who traveled from Europe. As I stay in Lekki, I also decided to relocate to the hotel for 3 days to reduce my travel time and stress. The staff were very courteous and friendly but the hotel needs a refurbishment. I think it's still living on its past glory. The lobby smelled damp, like the rooms as well. I could not say it was sparkling clean. They seem to economize on toiletries  - not expected from a Sheraton. There was dust under the chest in my room. One of my shoe covers was erroneously swept away. I did not use the internet so I'm not able to comment. Breakfast was good and the airconditioners chilled well.

First of all, I have to say that the staff was really perfect - very polite, helpful and professional. So far nothing to reproach.   The problem are the rooms here. Quite clean, but I noticed some staints on the bed linen. Washed, for sure, but still disgusting and should not happen in quite an expensive hotel like this.     Other thing - the rooms really need to refurbish and update. Room design seems to be from mid-nineties and so is also the level of how the items are worn-out. Scratched bathtub with rests of a kind of scotch tape, worn-out electrical switches...this is really not the Sheraton standard...  The lobby and reception area is quite nice (even if still very nineties-alike...), and so is the pool in the backyard.  Very good cuisine - there is one Italian restaurant

Review Title: Average hotel too expensive for its level of services
Review Text: The Sheraton in Lagos has the advantage of being nicely secured, but this one of its only advantages with the friendliness of the staff. The food served for breakfast and lunch was average, and the rooms smelt like cigarette even if this was a non-smoking room. I would say that the facilities and services are not worth the price charged by the hotel.

The hotel is centrally located and well kept with courteous and helpful staff across. Enjoying my stay and will definitely return or recommend this to a visitor in Lagos. The room is spacious with a study desk ideal for business travel, tea making facilities, stable wifi... The breakfast area was recently renovated and is excellent alongside the options provided.

I came here in April 2018 for business never having been to Nigeria before.  The staff was kind and check in went smooth.  First stop inside the hotel is Goodie’s bar that has the atmosphere of a small English pub which was pleasing.  I had a beer to soak in my surroundings for a bit and then headed over to the Pumpkin Leaf for a buffet style dinner.  The cleanliness, layout, and cuisine exceeded expectations and I was quite impressed.  Afterwards I went outside to have more drinks at the bar. The Sheraton did a good job setting up the outdoor accommodations and again I was impressed.   After a few drinks I went to my room to turn in for the night.  The room is comfortable, quiet, and clean which is all I could really ask for in a hotel.  I would highly recommend this location

Review Title: Good hotel to stay for a quick business trip in Lagos
Review Text: Located not far from the airport, the Lagos Sheraton hotel is the appropriate place to stay especially when you have to fly to others cities. It gives you good services needed for a full stay with restaurants and most of all the dedicated staff always available to make your stay great

This is the fourth time i have stayed here, and once again, the stay has been excellent. It has been updated since my last visit, which i must admit was required as it is showing its age. Anyway, the food, service and amenities have been excellent as always, and once again, a highlight has been the breakfast. The food is amazing, western and local, and the staff superb. Dolapo in particular always has a big smile and provides efficient, professional service anticipating all the needs of a business traveler. The hotel security is also very good.
Review Text

Review Title: Safe, Secure with Excellent Food Choices
Review Text: Pros of this hotel: - Very good security at the gate and at the entrance (screening all luggage and each guest) - Very good security in the hotel: in the lobby and someone is posted on each floor - Excellent food.  There are a few restaurants, so you can eat at the hotel every night without getting bored.  The area by the pool was fun, with excellent service and options for casual food.  Inside, there were a few more formal places.  Breakfast was my favorite with a full buffet offering and you order your eggs your way - Activities - if you are looking for other things to do, there is a casino and the pool area can be very social/active until late at night - Electric plugs - they had American and British outlets, making it super easy to charge your phone  Cons - Wifi.  Yes, they

Review Title: Good hotel Good service Good rooms for a Good stay
Review Text: I am at the Sheraton in Lagos Nigeria and its very Good,rooms had an upgrade since last time i was here,the carpet is gone and there is a laminate Floor instead,the bed is Good quality for a Good night sleep and the bathroom is standard but very ok!in the restaurant i had an indian curry and a local beer iT was Nice,i recommend this hotel for the Good service and hospitality,the bar is a must!locals,tourists and business men evrything Goes!

First time here and very happy with hotel. Everything you need and friendly staff too. Friday night is happy hour and great fun. Pool is good and away from work nice place to relax. Held few meetings here and very good for that too

Review Title: Close to the Airport with nice rooms
Review Text: Sheraton Lagos looks like an old hotel from the outside. The interiors do make up for it to some extent. The highlight in the lobby is the pool table where you can spend evenings with strangers if you so wish to. The gym is situated away from the main hotel beyond the pool but it's well equipped. Food is average both at the restaurants and in-room dining. Service is helpful and courteous.

Review Title: Excellent hotel with fine dining options
Review Text: Well although my overall experience of Lagos was not very great but hotel was something that helped me relax after a day of work. I stayed there for 5 days and traveled during the day for work. Food at the hotel restaurant was really well, I enjoyed local delicacies as well as some middle-eastern food. Local beer was also nice. If I visit lagos again then Sheraton again will be my choice of hotel.

Stayed here a couple of times during business trips. Typical Sheraton hotel, good service, spacious rooms, reasonable breakfast, nice pool.  Rooms can use a little update.. time for some renovation especially the bathrooms  Hotel is also used for big family parties, can be busy around those moments..  Live music (very loud) at the pool bar can be a minor complain if you need to sleep..

Oh MY!!... where to start...  there is no middle ground for these guys... EVERYTHING is BOTH good and bad...let me explain.....  1) The buffet area for Ngn 10,500 per head,(or USD 30)  the buffet area has   - no moderation on the background music (volume is either HIGH or ZERO).....BUT.... pretty artsy ambiance   - No internet service (wifi) (you get that ONLY as a check-in guest) ....BUT.... there is free wifi at the pool area (good.. people spend money here.. so keep them happy) and at a few (i repeat FEW) areas in the lobby (understandable as you don't want loiterers)....(BUT NO wifi AT THE BAR, AND THE BUFFET AREA????.. where people definitely spend money) like i said....1/2 assed services...   (((i will get to the bar and the lobby in a bit))))  - asked for an Americano...

Short daytime stay 12:00-19:00 Delta airlines offers business class passengers. Room was very nice and comfortable. Allowed free buffet lunch and access to the pool and internet. I was pleased with this service provided by Sheraton and Delta Airlines!! ...Note, you need to arrange your own transportation to the airport after checkout..

Really had fun with family  from 12th to 17th December. It was the right time to visit because it was Christmas season, people were coming in and out from different places, the atmosphere was awesome, the background Christmas songs in the lobby was so nice, staff were friendly, restaurant’s staff were helpful too, the food was tasty. What a memorable experience.

Very nice and friendly people. Very good happy hour menu with new buffet. Very beautiful and silent rooms at the 5th and 6th floor. Very good food at the pool restaurant. Very nice big swimmingpool. Very well attended by Temitayo at the club floor.
Review Text

Had a very good time over the Christmas holidays.  Shower was great. Staff were generally kind and helpful beginning with the reservations on to the Club floor and the main restaurant on the ground floor. Rooms were neither choked or overly spacious but every mod con was available including USB port. Shame about the satellite channels. Reception was fitful and I was hugely disappointed with the very limited choice of channels you really want to watch. Sheraton., you cannot provide Premium bouquet with the high room tariffs? I repeat, disappointing! The gym equipment was in tip top condition while the gentleman at the gym was great with guests.  Some drawbacks. Variety at the buffet was limited which is such a shame as the place was full most of the time. The menu needs a revamp.

Review Title: The rooms need a bit modernising
Review Text: Nice enough hotel, up to the Sheraton standards. Big and clean swimming pool with a lovely outdoor restaurant. The rooms are a bit dated and in need of renovation, unless you are in the Executive Floor, where the rooms are new and modern. The bathroom was definitely in desperate need of modernising.  At night the loud music coming from the swimming pool area can be a bit annoying, especially as the sound is quite...distorted! The staff are extremely welcoming and friendly. A true reflection of the Nigerian population. I always enjoy the food served by the pool, even if it’s quite expensive, if you consider the prices outside the safety of the hotel. All in all, a recommended hotel when you stay in this chaotic city.

I had last stayed at this hotel many years ago , and the experience was so bad that I never considered it during subsequent trips . The biggest advantage of staying here is that it is close to the business hubs and the airport, and with the traffic in Lagos being what it is , that can save you considerable time . So this time , since time was short , decided to try it out .  Was a pleasant surprise therefore to see that standards have considerably improved. Being a Starwood Preferred Guest helped me through a breezy check in , and in no time I was in my room on the Club Floor . Though the room is on the smaller side , the decor more than makes up for it . Housekeeping was excellent , and so was the room service . The Club Lounge is well maintained and a cosy place to relax after

i am a platinum spg memeber and i enjoyed my stay with the help of TEMITAYO at the club lounge she made my day and ELIZABETH she help me with my mails and checkout shecdule and peter at the Businessss centre who help me with my request. breakfast meal at the lounge should be of more verities like that of the pumpkin leaf restaurant.

Review Title: Pillows from Harrods, Toilet roll from Poundland
Review Text: Stayed in Lagos for 3 nights end of November, everyone said that the Sheraton is great (I didn't choose my hotel). I wasn't disappointed, the staff are super helpful and the room was excellent in every way, one thing i've never seen before is an exhibitionist shower (apparently that's what it's called) where the shower room is in full view of the bedroom, although there were pull across shutters if you wanted privacy. Another thing that impressed me was when i got back to the hotel at 2.45am and the bar shut at 3am the staff were willing to serve us later if we sat by the pool or in the lobby. I only had breakfast once which was great with plenty of choice, including some little chicken pieces which I loved. I had access to the club lounge on the 6th floor but didn't really use

Review Title: Arrogant Staff ... I repeat Arrogant Staff at Restaurant.
Review Text: We were on a business trip & believe me I was literally shocked as Sheraton hotels got good name. There was this lady at corner in pumpkin leaf restaurant who is serving sauteed vegetables & omlette. She got some issue it seems, was literally rude to everyone, who requested for her services. Everyone from my team was complaining.  During our check-out at reception they return us in Naira though they took USD.  Another point I noticed, that they need renovation badly.  Must say, it's not upto the mark.

Rooms: Design and equipment - outdated. Space - OK. Bad - Good. Windows can't be opened - bad. . AC system - old and noisy. WiFi - poor Breakfast: Food and choose - Good. Variety - moderate, all days the same. Bar near the pool - moderate. Beer is not always cool. Waiting time is adequate. Staff is friendly. Food is OK. Gym: It is exist. Small room with few equipment and free weights. Not possible to breath if more than 4 personas are inside. Overall impression - if measure this hotel using EU scales - a bit overpraised and old hotel used to be close to 5 stars. But in Lagos some other values are important - security, for example. And there is everything is OK with security.

Review Title: Old school hotel with quite expensive rates
Review Text: I stayed during a business trip, the hotel isn't bad. For the price I paid, I just didn't feel I got value. The hotel seems to have been around for while. The amenities in the room was outdated, with only one plug point in the entire room, these days with multiple gadgets, it was a bit of challenge to charge all of them.  The bathroom, picture attached was quite substandard. The shower was weak, either very hot or cold.   The staff is friendly, cheerful and helpful, no complaints on that front.   There always seem to be a crowd around the lobby area, which can be quite disturbing,

Review Title: We had a lunch with the graduating set of ROSECITY TOTAL CHILD ACADEMY
Review Text: It was a parting lunch for the outgoing set of 2016/2017 academic session. Saturday August 26, 2017. It was indeed a great experience for the children. Food was well prepared and sumptuous. Good service indeed

The Sheraton Lagos is perfect. Minutes from the airport, the rooms are spacious and have been renovated. WiFi is excellent. The food is delicious (especially in the Italian restaurant). But the most important is the TEAM. Everything is made for YOU. A perfect, paramount place in Lagos!
Review Text

First stay at the hotel and are in overall very happy with my stay. Check in procedure was fast and efficient. Breakfast was not that great but had the essentials. Staff was however very friendly. Room Service lunch was great with the servings hot and tasty. Room bathroom needs an upgrade. Basin plug leaks alot. Shower in bath is uncomfortable and is not user friendly for a tall person. Bed was comfortable and linen was clean and fresh. Dinner buffet servings was not that great as some servings did not look appetizing. Staff was however friendly and helpful. Wifi was slow and buffers a lot when viewing videos.  Regards

Stayed here 3 nights for Crusade prepaid the booking with a preference of having 2 single beds in our room as we were two men sharing the room. On arrival pre booked preference  was ignored and we were told that first thing in the morning a room would be made available for us. Nothing happened for any of the 3 nights we stayed there. My friend had to sleep on an uncomfortable mattress for three nights while we payed top dollar.   Come checkup the duty manager was unaccommodating and unhelpful and refused to reimburse some of the costs incurred while staying extremely uncomfortable. Reimbursed a fraction of the diner bill which equates to probably 1% of the total bill for our stay  Food took long and some meals were not as asked for. Taste of hamburgers were off also not given

Review Title: 27 years later it still feels like coming home
Review Text: Well, the headline says it all...  The Hotel has seen some few changes over the years and apart from the Club rooms all others require renovations and upgrades to the 21st Century but when considering the operating environment one must admit that the staff is trying hard to ensure that their guests can enjoy their stay.

Review Title: Close to airport and totally OK
Review Text: I've stayed here twice and had pretty much the same experience both times. It is an OK hotel but a bit pricey for what it offers. It is close to the airport which is a def. plus; avoid arriving/departing at peak hours and you can get to the airport in 10 minutes or so. Rooms are OK, a bit dated but with comfy beds and clean bathroom (but the shower was very weird).   Breakfast and lunch buffet were OK but the coffee is really not good so bring your own if you care about coffee quality. Italian restaurant is overpriced and food not good.  The business center is open 24/7 which is great but it was a total rip-off so avoid unless you really have to use it! Internet is OK and free=+

Location means everything. Close to airport, therefore it beats the traffic issues Lagos is suffering. For short visits it has what most people need in a hotel. Restaurants, pool, gym, lounge, live music weekends. Friendly Nigerian staff serving around the clock. Sometimes need a bit patience with the speed of the service.

Good hotel in the chaotic city of Lagos. Very capable and friendly staff. The pool bar closes a bit early (around 22:30). Some power outs at night are to be expected but generally last a short time. Rooms are clean and all is in working order. Free water bottles provided in the room.

This hotel is very conveniently located near the Airport. Especially when you arrive late night and need to connect in the morning. Uber is an easy way to get there and back. Just be patient. The hotel and especially the rooms are dated and need a revamp ...

This was a good hotel that is convienent for the airport, nice pool and bar area and  a good selection for an early breakfast. Rooms were as expected for the hotel and staff were very friendly. If you're heading to Airport early in morning a worthwhile spot.

Review Title: A bit pricey, but happy to have it
Review Text: Hotel is pretty much your standard Shearton, could use a little bit of an upgrade but all in all not bad. They have a few restaurants, a daily buffet that's not bad, but could benefit from some more variety; a bbq out on the pool deck which on the days it's offered I found to be the best bet and an Italian restaurant that can hold its own but nothing to write home about. They have a nice lobby bar and a little pub type bar. Both nice, but again could use a little updating. The rooms have actually been recently refurbished, at least the ones on the Starwood floor. The beds are very good. Some of the more comfortable beds I've had in a hotel. The staff I found all to be very polite, but from a service stand point a bit hit and miss, some are great, some seem lost in their jobs.

Review Title: Only one night but very enjoyable
Review Text: Service was good, pleasant evening in the pool terrace bar.  Room clean and tidy, security was good.  As it was only one night in transit I didn't have time to try everything but would certainly stay again based on my limited experience there.
Review Text

for a Sheraton though, i wasn't very impressed. First and foremost, this is the most expensive Sheraton i have stayed in. (well i haven't stayed in the four points in Lagos yet) but in comparison to Sheraton Abuja, Its ridiculously more expensive.

Review Title: Terrible experience during Friday night outside Sheraton Poolside restaurant
Review Text: A business associate of mine and I invited some high profile Chinese Media clients to an evening's entertainment on a Friday night with live music at the Sheraton Ikeja, Lagos. The service was good and the evening highly entertaining with our compliments to the musicians.  However from around 10.30pm whilst we were enjoying ourselves drinking and eating, waiters started removing tables and chairs with numerous clients still enjoying themselves, including our party. It became intrusive and loud with chairs being stacked up next to us, as well as tables being cleared all over the restaurant. Furthermore, it turned into a very noisy "Grand Central station" with the chairs being stacked and moved away on trolleys.  Here we were in a Sheraton Hotel enjoying an evening with

The Hotel is well located in a very calm side in Ikeja,Lagos.  My friends and I decided to have a weekend getaway.   We were told to get the Club room because we were 3 sharing a room. The bed size was big enough but unfortunately the room was kind of small. I think the hotel was trying to manage the space with so much amenities in a room.  Breakfast was the best for me...We really enjoyed ourselves.(They have a wide variety of Meal/options.)  Breakfast is only served to one occupant of the room(Hotel Standard), the 2nd occupant has to pay for their breakfast.  Dinner was quite a disappointment until we were informed by one of the waiter that they had different days for different continental meals. Ensure you know what that particular dinner is before you get disappointed like i

Chose this hotel for a quick overnight pitstop before a domestic flight. Positives are close to the airport, good security, nice bars, food and service. Letdowns are the rooms which are dated and with a lingering odor. Toilet needs a serious change as mine was very dirty. Might be back for the great staff and proximity to airport.

The rooms are good and sound proof. The reception area is very crowded at any point of time. The room acess card is very poor quality as you have to get it charged every day if you forgot and keep it near your mobile.  The breakfast as well as dinner buffet lacks variety for vegetarian persons. If you order alacarte then the wait is very long.  Overall the staff was very courteous.

The rooms here are so comfortable, staff are very courteous and friendly. They respond to needs very quickly. They place is heavily secured making it safe considering the location of the hotel. The buffet dinner wasn't good, not good value for money at all

I stayed there for one day. Staff were friendly throughout my visit, at check in and check out and at the restaurants.   While the hotel might look a bit outdated from the outside, they have clearly renovated inside. My room was clean, the bed very comfortable, the bathroom ok. I felt save throughout, with extra security staff on each of the floors and of course at the entrance.   The gym is well equipped. I especially enjoyed staying at the pool bar outside.   I did not try the breakfast, so cannot comment on it, but we had a good buffet lunch here.  I have read some of the negative comments here and was a bit concerned, but can only say that I had a very good experience, in line with Sheraton hotels elsewhere.

Sheraton Lagos Hotel is an exiting place to stay. During my recent visit to Lagos, I found it so nice and inviting. The staff are so warm and courteous. The rooms are clean,  beds very spacious and comfortable. Their wide screen TV sets offers great entertainment. The daily room maintenance is pleasant. Their cuisine-a mixture of local and international delicacies-gives one a wide range of tasty dishes to sample.  Their 24-hour steady internet connectivity makes it really easy to work and also puts one constantly in touch with the world at the click of your computer, tablet or phone batons/keys. The lounge is nicely decorated with spacious comfortable seats for relaxation.  And it's not far from the international airport. The Hotel's ambience is indeed seductive. It's a place of

Review Title: Not the best, but friendly staff
Review Text: This hotel is heavily secured. This makes it a safe hotel to stay in. However the rooms are outdated and not very clean.  The bathroom feels old and needs renovation. Stayed here several times and several times the fridge in the room wasn't working. The gym is fine. Breakfast isn't really good, except for the coffee machine and the cook baking eggs. Staff is helpful and friendly.

Review Title: Good Management staff but an old infrastructure
Review Text: The hotel is almost 30 years old and are the rooms and interiors. Never felt a Sheraton experience until the duty manager provided me a free upgrade to the club rooms. I really appreciate this gesture from the duty manager.  Security checks and guards at each floor and elevator entries is commendable.  I would recommend only club rooms in this hotel to avoid disappointment. I was told by staff to book directly at the hotel desk for best prices rather using any travel website.  Pool bar is a good place to hangout. The staff was occasionally rude during the breakfast.   Gym does not have a steam or sauna and the hotel has a salon managed by a third party in the name of spa.  Overall an average experience with facilities but cheers to the duty manager !!
Review Text

Awful room, old, tired, smelly and a bathroom that is something out of the 70's. In desperate need of updating.  I lifted the sheets on the bed to find a dried out blood stain on the mattress.  The bathroom was awful, limescale marks on the toilet bowl.  Not a Sheraton at all.  I stayed in a room on the first floor.

I just attended a wedding reception and had to wait an hour for the couple to arrive so I was opportuned to hang around for a while. Bathrooms at the reception smelly but look clean at first glance...A female porter almost ran me over with her luggage trolly , when I engaged her she offered no apology...The security guard at the main entrance was rude. Something as simple as asking for directions to the reception hall was met with silence at first and then mumbles from the many uniforned staff standing around the lobby. Old looking property with poorly trained staff.

Stayed her for two nights and I wish I could wipe it from my memory. I echo other travelers who say this should not be part of the Starwood group since it diminishes the reputation of the brand. Check in was disorganized with the front desk lady chatting with her coworkers completely ignoring me. They ran out of money so I couldn't exchange cash and the room the put me in is circa 1980 and was dirty. There were dead bugs in the closet, dirty floors, no slippers and a toilet that was...disturbingly gross.  Checkout was an equal nightmare. Avoid if possible.

I know it's Nigeria....but repeated power cuts, poor wifi...but friendly staff.  However I I have suffered 24 hrs of food poisoning....from eating there.... I come here as I have to.... Rooms ok, don't drink the water!!

Review Title: A very good business hotel in Lagos
Review Text: This is the best hotel in Lagos that is close to the international airport and to the domestic airport. It is well maintained and well managed and has an excellent restaurant, a nice pool and a well equipped gym. For business people visinting Lagos it is the best place to stay.

Review Title: Only suitable for a short stay
Review Text: Spent a night here. I think the hotel management should start thinking of making do with the rug. the stench from it is unbearable. from my last stay, there seem to be some improvements in the rooms, but they could do better. the food was good. staff were nice

Good Hospitality, more of commercial approach than humanly approach, restaurant was good and food was well served and the gym was also nice place.  Inside the Gym, the coach was really friendly.  Over all it was a good experience for me.

Spent two nights at the Sheraton Lagos as my organisation was hosting a workshop in the hotel.   Arrived at reception to be greeted by very friendly staff and was allocated a double bed as requested. When I arrived in my room I was pleasantly surprised as I wasn't expecting great things after a disappointing stay in the Sheraton Four Points on VI previously. The room was spacious and clean and the bed was plenty big enough for 3 of me! Bathroom was good too but I couldn't find a hairdryer and slippers would have been a nice touch to go with the bathrobe.   Security was really good with a security guard situated at the lift on each floor. They were always professional and polite. Other staff were incredibly helpful and friendly and my colleagues who arranged the workshop were

Very professional conduct with high standards....rooms are a little bit old but it makes up with some good maintenance and facilities. Newly upgraded rooms are great and the club is quite good. Breakfast is also fine.

A friend recommended that we stay at the newly upgraded and renovated Sheraton Lagos.   A few years ago, I had the worst experience ever but still decided to try it one more time.   The front desk agents were friendly and checked us in on time.   So the renovated rooms are all located on the 6th floor. These new rooms are excellent. Good size room and a decent size bathroom.  The floor also has a club lounge which serves breakfast and refreshments through the day. The selection of food and beverages was ok.   From my last stay, I must say that the service has significantly improved and staff are friendly.   Great food available at the Italian restaurants. Don't forget to try their pizzas, the best I've had in Nigeria.   The hotel also has a health club but it's 5 min walk from
Review Text

The staff were cheerful and helpful when they could assist with any issues. The room was clean and comfortable. The choices for breakfast were limited. Wifi ok although the   electricity went off many times during the short stay.

Arrived early evening of 13th May to an exciting evening at the club lounge. On arrival the club receptionist's attitude was electrifying. It was as if the staffs were seeing me for the first time. I'll not forget the duty manager's call asking after my well being.

The hotel is just fine. Pros: It is close to the airport and has better amenities and facilities than most hotels in the country, but just Ok by international standards. Security is fine and the hotel staff are friendly. We ordered Room service and the food (both local and international) was good. Cons: The shower did not properly contain the water and leaked out so the floor was very wet after a shower

Review Title: Always go for a room upgrade
Review Text: This hotel is conveniently situated close to the airport.  if you arrive late at night this is your best bet.  Check-in was efficient and rooms were ready. The room is where the problem started. initially i was booked into a room on the third floor.  One's first impression of the room is not too bad "wooden floor, modern finishes etc", but once you enter the bathroom all happy thoughts dissipate.  The bathroom features one of those horrid baths with the built in shower and shower curtain (in my humble opinion those should be banned worldwide from all 4 star and up hotels!).  I sat on my bed contemplating how i would keep clean without having to do the "shower dance" where you try and avoid touching the curtain whilst showering when my phone rang and i was advised of my upgrade

Review Title: Great Hotel and Convenient for Airport
Review Text: I stayed here for 7 nights and loved every second of it.  The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  The hotel is clean and has a good selection of restaurants.  The pool area is good and not too busy.  Friday nights by the pool were great with the live entertainment.  Thanks for an amazing experience and to Barry and all the staff...a huge thank you for making me feel so welcome.

Review Title: Great food, loud musique, and Front Desk with a memory problem
Review Text: I have attended several events here. But this is the first time I am spending time in the rooms. The food is great and the pineapples are worth a return for.  There was some kind of music on Friday night, which was really loud and it cost me my sleep. Other colleagues also complained  But the Front Desk guys, really? If you need something, you need to go down. If they tell you "I will call you back" it wont happen. Three times they  said they were calling back.. three times they forgot.

Review Title: A decent hotel in West Africa
Review Text: The hotel, as a part of the Sheraton group, maintains a very good level of service, cleanliness and facilities. Compared to other 'International Branded' hotels in this region of Africa, the Sheraton Lagos have a good set of staff who are friendly, attentive and responsive to your requests.  Remembering that this is indeed a Nigerian City Hotel, it provides a relatively quiet atmosphere away from the outside hustle and bustle.
