Saying that, the bar and outdoor restaurant areas do get busy and lively over the weekend. The pool area is in need of renovation, although the pool itself is clean and well maintained. Some investment in the grounds are sorely needed. There are a few abandoned containers and other unsafe for children oddities near the 'jogging area'. A children's playpark

The very and only reason to stay: Security. Flawless. Straight forward. Rooms are strangely old-school, 70s rather than 80s. Tariffs incomprehendeable. The relative proximity to the airport is priced in... To make it your day: Pool Bar! Order a grilled fish to go with your beer.

I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. Their standards where very good for being in the middle of Africa. The pool and food was nice and the rooms were clean. The security of the hotel was also very good!

Review Title: Not so good / not very bad 40% quality of stay
Review Text: Not standard 5 stars hotel service Response to call for different services are slow and sometimes ignored I had a bad experience of not registering a wake up call it is mainly for business stay - nothing match for pleasure to be done in this hotel
Review Text

If you are lounging at Sheraton I advise you to book and reserve floor 6 this room are highly furnished toilet need to the unbeatable performance .this is a lovely and unwinding hotel .Khalifa Naziru Abdullahi

The hotel was excellent  - the service could not have been better or the staff more helpful. I stayed for over a week, and was very well looked after. The rooms are comfortable and the internet high speed. I will be back!

Review Title: Had to change room multiple times
Review Text: I have to change room twice! I saw several big cockroaches in the wash room as soon as I entered the first room - it was super disgusting. The drain doesn't work for the second room. I didn't want to move again so I asked the front desk to send someone to fix it. It was fixed alright, but in the next morning I noticed the water leaking in the wash room. It took them a long time to send someone up and I was told the pipe was broken. I have to change to a third room! The person who led to the third room wanted me to take a look at the room and asked me to make sure I see no problem and happy about the room, as if I was being picky or something!   The room was gloomy and dark - I had a very small window which won't open. The room felt very damp and had this damp and stale smell.

This is a good hotel, close to the International and the Domestic airport. Rooms are large, big bed, fast internet (up to 3 devices included in room rate), nice pool and terrace and 2 good restaurants. Always nice to be here.

Staying there for much longer than anticipated. The departing flights were cancelled due to bad weather for days. So the Hotel has the advantage of being in the close vicinity of the domestic Airport.  Breakfast is acceptable as is the room service. The Gym is outside the Hotel at the Tennis courts. You gotta go through the pool bar on the way. For those that like it. Hotel staff is friendly, helpful and have a tendency being funny;-). Do not consider a price value approach - just accept or stay at a different place.

Review Title: Pricey, but great for business travel
Review Text: Accommodations were great for an 8-night stay for business.  Security is very tight, from the guards at the front gate to the personnel waiting by the elevator bays.  The entire staff was efficient and professional, and the car service in the lobby did a great job arranging rides for our group.  Room was nice, if a bit worn.  Bathroom could definitely use a refresh.  Nice pool and outdoor dining area.  We were there Feb. 14, and the Valentine's Day buffet was wonderful!  Great combination of African and international fare; overall the food was very good throughout our stay.   Due to a midnight flight, I had late checkout and wanted to shower after being by the pool all afternoon.  The gym is separate from the main building and is not somewhere I would want to walk around at

I stayed for one night on the 30th of December. As you drive in, there's a sense of security. It's less of a market place than Sheraton Abuja. More secluded. There was a good choice for breakfast.The porters are great as well as those at the reception. The lobby could do with an update.This is my second time here and l'll stay again.

What can I say! The lobby area looks like it could do with a complete overhaul. It is so shabby and reeks of the 80's /90's. The cocktails were poorly done, The balance was off and it was sickly.  I was shocked to see a snooker table in the lobby, which is not the ambience you expect when you fancy a quiet drink.   The chairs look grubby and there is this sense of old, shabbiness that doesn't match the brand.   All in all, this place looks like it has been neglected and is trading on its former glory. We planned to eat - but based on the above, we'd lost confidence that we'd be happy with the food.  I wonder if the management are aware of these issues?

Good to stay for business travel. High on safety in the unsafe environment. Food spread is good with all kind of choices.   Opt for newly made rooms. Old rooms are not so good.  Food can be custom made as per your requirement.

Review Title: Good for business trip in Lagos
Review Text: Sheraton is a good hotel, located close to the airport . Good place to be if you do business in Ikeja and avoid chaotic traffic in the city. High quality of service, room cleaned , although a bit old fashion. Good internet connection . The pool is very nice and big enough to exercice.
Review Text

The hotel is conveniently located near the airport with security access. It has a few restaurant / dinner options on site. The buffet is okay & a typical hotel buffet option. The Italian is okay for Nigeria but nothing special. Again the breakfast is okay without being anything special. The hotel is a little dated & in need of some renovation. There is a small casino on site & a bar in the hotel frequented by local ladies during our visit. Typical issues with credit cards, speed of service & level of service at reception similar to other hotels in the area that I have stayed at previously.

Sheraton till date is one of the best hotels I even been to in Nigeria. You treated like royalty which really the whole idea. It's so comfortable, its home away from home for me and I totally recommend it to anyone interested in a good ol' Me time!

Yes it's an old hotel not that much far from  logos international airport approximately 15 to 25 minutes with escorts and depend of the traffic. Hotel bar is quiet busy with business mens and cabin crew. Italian restaurant in the hotel lobby and the good things that a nice outside pool bar which can provide you beers, chicha and they have bbq night once a week. I think every night they doing a theme buffet. You can have your Breakfast at the main restaurant with local food and other international dishes. Last and not least the night club of the hotel during weekend is crowded with in-house guests and girls. It's fun... If you need to go outside of the hotel make sure that you are safe. Exactly 2 minutes walking from the hotel there is a supermarket belong to a Lebanese

Sheraton Hotel Ikeja continues to rank best among equals based on my assessment. In the past couple of months I have been to several cities in Nigeria and stayed in quite a few (and there are a few) top hotels in Lagos. I can say unequivocally that Sheraton Hotel Ikeja is it. The two top floors are exquisitely furnished. The  staff are very courteous and friendly. You notice this from the security teams at the entrance and it reflects throughout the personnel in every department that i have interacted with. Kudos Sheraton for the consistency.

The room was spacious and comfortable with nearly all the amenities that you could wish for. The bathroom could definitely do with some refurbishment, however was generously proportioned with a bath/shower. The only real issue I have to list is the noise generated by the archway metal detector outside the hotel entrance. I understand the need for security, however the continual bleeping throughout the day and night was a minor inconvenience as the windows are not totally sound proof - much like the walls of the room. Moreover, although I commend the hotel in having every type of power socket in the room, you do have to remember to pack multiple travel adaptors should you wish to charge several devices. However, I must commend the welcome that was received by the hotel staff, and

Review Title: Nice and calm in the chaos of Ikeja
Review Text: The Hotel is huge and normally very expensive (as all hotels in west Africa) but you can get good deals online. Rooms are nice and big, bed is comfortable, bathrooms are in need of urgent renovation since they look quite old. Lovely pool and open bar around it and nice sport pub close to the lobby. Forget the Italian restaurant, La Giara, you don't really need to eat Italian there!

The reception staff were so friendly, helpful, speak understandable English (an important thing in Nigeria since they another sort of English for communication between different tribes which affects how they speak English with other English speakers). Rooms were clean and the response to change my room for the insecticide heavy smell was relatively fast. The A/C was very high and no way to be turned off. Standard wifi speed was good enough to fulfill my needs for business with up to three concurrent devices. My room didn't have a view and I think standard business rooms don't. TV had lots of "Not available" channels and nearly no entertainment ones after long business days; you might only find Business focused channels. Food was nice with pretty good portions of food, but the

Review Title: SHERATON LAGOS/IKEJA still the best possible choice
Review Text: Coming to Nigeria since 1976 I must admit that the Sheraton in Lagos just outside the Airport is still the best possible choice if you stay in Lagos. It has maintained its high standards over all the years I am visiting it and now with the newly renovated Club rooms in the 5th and 6th floor it is a stunning experience. Prices are moderate and the garden/pool area are still one of the best and relaxing corners in that hot spot of Africa. Can only recommend it.

Just returned from a business trip to Lagos, 1st time since around 2010 and went back to the Sheraton. I am happy to say that the refurbishments since my last visit there are of a very high quality, the Club room that I stayed in was excellent; large, airy, clean, well laid out.......couldn't fault it. One thing that I am happy to say is that the service, staff and facilities are even better than they were on my previous trips and they were very good then.......I didn't think it possible. As an example of this; my reservation was made through my own company's administration and I assumed all was well but 2 days before my travel date I still hadn't received confirmation I was getting concerned. I contacted Thonia Akanegbu who was the reservation assistant in 2010 and asked for

Good hotel in close proximity to airport. Airport transfer available at reasonable cost. Hotel offers good quality  room with Starwood quality. Spacious room with all the amenities required. Nice to see a selection of different wall plugs available with European, American and East and South African available. Good gym and nice options for evening drinks and good restaurant available. Lovely pool area!
Review Text

I had heard disturbing things about Nigeria so was a little apprehensive about what I might find. I found a very good hotel! Excellent staff, comfortable room, good food, careful but relatively unobtrusive security, a comfortable foyer for meet and greet, and a friendly 'floor observer' to monitor comings and goings. Well situated close to the airport and set back from the road so that monitored entry to the property was far from the building itself. Judging by Sunday brunch -excellent - the hotel is very popular with local people. Altogether a very pleasant experience.

Best hotel I ever visited in Africa. I was given a newly renovated room. The rooms very nice and up to date, the ambiance was great, the food was pretty good.  I have one complaint is that the kitchen does not know how to cook a steak. I ordered a medium steak but they brought it to me almost uncooked. I had to send it back and watch my friends eat their meals while my food is getting fixed. When the food came back the steak was still raw. I then asked for desert but what they had on the menue they said it won't be available until 25 minutes later.

Ok this is weird, but I rate pillows when lodging in any hotel 😂 Sheraton Lagos had soft and dreamy pillows.. The Pina Colada from the pool side restaurant needs more coconut milk. Overall it was a nice stay for me as I wasn't really expecting much tbvh

Serving good food. Font office staff is very helpful and provide good hospitality service. Conditions of the rooms are average and food in restaurants is amazing & delicious. Friendly staff and beautiful arts with craft in the lobby. Very closer to the main road. Atmosphere in lobby is peaceful and very friendly.

The New and Improved Sheraton Hotel Ikeja Lagos. I stayed at the Sheraton Hotel Ikeja Lagos and can tell you that it is second to none in Nigeria and certainly ranks among the top in the world. The 5th and 6th floors have been remodeled and the rooms are more cozy that previous states. The bathrooms are great with the showers much higher to accommodate those of us vertically enhanced. In previous state, I would have to stoop to get water to my head. Now I just stand underneath the shower heat and feel the rain. What a great feeling to start you off early. Will certainly come back and hope to get the 5th or 6th floors. Come try it out. Customer Service remains their watchword. Very courteous staff.

This is really not a five stars hotel.  The rooms are very old and the service is not good The only good thing is to have diner outside as they have a buffet service quite ok We had an early check in after a long flight and it took them 40' to check us in which is just not acceptable with the people being even a bit rude because we were asking them to accelerate as we wanted to have a shower to be able to go for business meetings. Won't go there again.

Very good, neat and hospitable.  I love the friendly  environment and it's well trained staffs. Service with passion is the goal. I was also privileged to visit the swimming pool and the bar with good friends.

A poor 5* hotel. Very dated rooms. Blue tiled bathroom. Brown water-funnily enough not safe to drink ... Laminate floors therefore very noisy.. Power cuts standard Rooms due an overhaul. Just we didn't/don't get them.  However this is Nigeria.... The hotel is safe. Busy on weekends... Average food menu. Pizza is ok... I wouldn't stay here by choice but then I wouldn't come here by choice...

Stayed here for four nights, staff friendly, facilities especially gym and bars good. Has atmosphere unlike other Lagos hotels. However the rooms are a big let down, very tired especially bathrooms, rusting fittings, big gaps. Badly in need of TLC and a refurb

I was only here one night, toward the end in April, and really had no problems with the hotel.  We were here for work, and arrived mid afternoon. Are flight didn't leave until late night the next day. So we were actually booked for two days. We were not originally happy with are rooms, so we paid for an upgrade. The upgrade was about 65 to 70 dollars, and the rooms were a lot nicer. You have access to the lounge, which is across from check in. The lounge has beer, some snacks, no charge with the upgrade. With the upgrade we received a late check out, and didn't have to pay for a second night. The staff was very friendly, and attentive. Securiy is good, and everybody is checked before they drive in. We actually saw two weddings while at the hotel. I could only recommend this
Review Text

I stayed in the Sheraton on business. The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly. The rooms are comfortable. As always use bottled water to brush your teeth and to drink. The food was average, I ate mostly fruit at breakfast. A comfortable, clean hotel.

This hotel (located close to the airport) is a great choice in Lagos.  It is smaller than similar convention hotels around the world and offers a nice calm surroundings.  The rooms are nicely decorated and comfortable.  Bathrooms are modern and very clean.  The restaurant is wonderful, food is excellent and service is top notch.  All in all a recommended stay in Lagos

I had a very nice and (i think) newly renovated Club room, in one of the top floors. room was spacious and clean. Food was ok. Public areas and restaurants are ok, but look a little bit old furnished. Very nice was the gym…small, but newly equipped and with proper working AC. Staff was friendly, check in / check out without any problems. Felt safe all the time. AC and Wifi was working properly in the entire hotel. A solid business hotel..would stay there again.

The hotel is adequate, the air conditioning in the rooms are nice and cold .The restaurant and room service are good . The personnel at checkout desk can be quite abrupt. The Lobby area is quite warm and they have many blackouts during my stay.

One would think Sheraton safeguards service and hospitality globally. In Nigeria levels are measured differently. Being early for a business meeting I decided to process some emails. Which - when travelling abroad - can be a fairly GB intense activity. So I searched and found Wi-Fi. Several as a matter of fact. Regrettably all of them required a password. The unfriendly bar tender referred my to the reception, where both operators informed me I was expected to pay. Pay.. for Wi-Fi... While having my drinks and a snack. Waiting for more people, more drinks and diner later on in the crockpot. Admitted; I was staying in the Oriental hotel in Ikoyi and how happy I am for this choice. Friendly staff, who - without asking or mentioning your room number issue the Wi-Fi code for free,

Review Title: Still fantastic value for money for events
Review Text: As the chairman of the local organizing committee for the annual scientific meeting for our professional organisation, I was looking for special venue to both reward the hard-working doctors and still be within their budgets. The fine people of Sheraton worked assiduously to ensure that both objectives were delivered. The food was well presented, plentiful and on time. I have never been able to fault their service and they did not let me down. Guess what? The unanimous decision has been taken to repeat the venue again this year!

After several days travel, this hotel was an oasis! Wonderful linens. attentive staff and the buffet dinners and lunches are so convenient when your time is limited. The hotel felt safe with plenty of security around. And the mattress/bed was to die for - we did not want to get out of it..

Stayed he on two separate nights this week.   Good security at gate and at lift lobby and each floor. Felt very safe.  Reception very efficient and friendly.  Room excellent, very good bed and slept well.  The pub was great to watch football, and enjoy a draft beer and a meal. Very good barman.  Breakfast good as well with nice freshly cooked omelettes.  Would definitely stay here agin when next in Lagos

I was pleased to go back to the Sheraton on my last visit. Room very clean and comfortable especially the bed. Wifi works, which has been a problem elsewhere. Food menu at the pool bar has been completely revamped and is now much more comprehensive.  I found the quality of food to be high and service is fine, I tend to sit at the bar as I'm usually travelling alone. Also pleasant lounging around the lobby area in the evening. Definitely my preferred place to stay in Lagos.

Sorry if I seem hard with my review.  The beds are very comfortable, staff are hit and miss, my room appeared clean and usual SPG amenities. TV was good. Kettle in my room didn't work.   I'm rating this hotel poor for the F&B, politely put its awful.   Three lots of room service, poor in quality, taste and inadequate ingredients.   Coffee is the worst I've drank anywhere around the globe.   Very disappointing that this hotel still comes under the SPG umbrella, carries the good name Sheraton.   I have fed back to SPG directly about the poor quality of food.   Next time I will self cater.
Review Text

Was here for a short visit. Rooms appear to have been upgraded.  Staff the usual pleasant and polite. Dined in the Pool Terrace Bar  Given the economic times one would have expected some specials on offer for walk in customers.

Review Title: Comfortable, with friendly bar...food not so good.
Review Text: Very comfortable rooms and friendly staff with a cosy bar.. Poolside restaurant is best place to eat, but make sure you stick to basic meals like burgers, or maybe a local curry... Otherwise you will be disappointed.  Generally a good idea to avoid ice...and don't drink tap water.

Review Title: stayed for first time in lagos sheraton
Review Text: Its a good property but very old and vintage in interiors , I would not call it value for money its very expensive . I am a platinum SPG member and use SPG properties exclusively but am not very impressed by the hotel their out door resturant is good

Dated hotel and on the lower end of the Sheraton portfolio. Stayed 3 nights, staff and service is excellent. I was on the 4th floor in an SPH room, quite and spacious , comfortable bed, working sitcom etc.... Fitness suit is good, restaurants and bars are expensive but good . Italian is very good. Overall a good hotel that is dated it suitable for anyone staying upto a week on business.

I actually would like to focus on the buffet restaurant where we went with 12 colleagues for lunch. Having been on a regular basis to the restaurant over the years, we were all looking forward to eating to the highest food standards the Sheraton group is renowned for...  The overall experience was extremely disappointing with a definite shift in cuisine from international to domestic.  I have had the pleasure of eating smoked salmon, beef, chicken, a wide assortment of fish a great salad bar on many occasions over the four years I have been coming to the hotel.  There is very little left of this once magnificent restaurant, with the exception of Friday night live music nights with an outdoor grill.... (still a great experience!)  However the main restaurant has lost us as

The Sheraton Lagos Hotel is located on Mobolaji Bank-Anthony Way in Ikeja. A veritable institution in the hosptality industry, this is one of the best established hotels in Lagos. Great staff, lovely facilities and nice location (for the airport)

Review Title: Classic Sheraton..Still maintains its classy ambience
Review Text: It was a pleasant experience staying at Sheraton after a long time. And I must say that even though the hotel is old, it retains its class and is not by any chance lacking any modern amineties whatsoever. The staff is also very friendly, welcoming and helpful. All my concerns were addressed well in time and room service was also very good. Being a Muslim, I was a bit disheartened to not get Halal non-vegetarian food but whatever I did eat was delicious. Special mention to the short-haired lady security guard who stands by the lifts (afternoon to evening shift).. she's extremely sweet and warm.

I have to say that for the standard of a Sheraton hotel this one in Lagos was completely below the standards, the swimmingpool was OK a part the noise of workers on the street behind the walls, food from the restaurant was amazing and I really suggest you to have an Italian dinner or have the buffet with local food! Very impressed with culinary variety offered but not impressed with the room cleaning standards

Been here a number of time over the past few years. Staff are always polite and friendly although a little disorganised. Rather tired now,but believe a recent is about to start going by the New bedroom pictures up behind reception.  Food dull and expensive. Noisy corridors, not alot of consideration by housekeeping staff.

The Sheraton is supposed to be one of the better hotels in Lagos, Nigeria. Upon arrival in the evening we had too wait almost an hour for our room, because the hotel had a ' high occupancy' . Not such a good first impression. As a compensation we were offered a drink and a snack, but after a long journey you just want to go to your room. The room I got was quite convenient: good, hard shower, nice spacious bed, good working air conditioning , writing desk, good flat screen tv with free movie channels.  The breakfast restaurant is something else...furniture is really outdated ( or it has to be your taste), with dirty carpet. Buffet is good , but in such environment it just doesn't taste that good. There are tennis courts, small swimming pool, fitness room . Not a hotel to have a
Review Text

I have stayed at the Sheraton many times and have been critical that it was in need of modernisation, having stayed there again this week I am pleased to report that the newly refurbished bedrooms are up to date in appearance and of a very high standard. The bars and dining areas are acceptable but would benefit from being modernised. The hotel continues take security seriously and as a guest I always feel safe. As during my previous visits the staff are all friendly and do their best to please. To summarise, the Sheraton is a safe base for visitors to Lagos and the accommodation is getting better.

After the renovation of the upper floors, it has become really nice. When you stay there I recomment to ask for rooms in the upper floors and say not in direction to the pool. There have often open buffets with life music until late in the night which realy I can recomment... but if you have a room in this direction, you cant sleep..  The staffs are very friendly and the food is also very good! You have several restaurants so you can find something for everyone and you can stay a few days there, without do you have left the hotel area.

It had been about 15 years since my last visit to the Sheraton Lagos and although not much has changed, the rooms are up-to-standard, being fresh and looking modern. The main selling point for this hotel is the friendly staff; from breakfast, pool-bar, reception and gym. Everyone is very pleasant and the hotel is just 25 minutes from the airport. Do mind the traffic though, as it can take much more than one hour to reach the airport.

Im a regular guest of the Sheraton Lagos hotel.I have always found it to be one of the most relaxing and friendliest hotels that Ive stayed in. The staff are always friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms on the upper floors(SPG) floors have been completely renovated recently  and having stayed in one of these new rooms I found it to be excellent in my opinion and comparable to the best that can be found in Europe so it makes Lagos a better experience. The fact that there are several bars and restaurants to choose from all within the one hotel complex makes for a good variety and is very good especially for long term guests as opposed to just a lobby bar which is all too common in many of the hotels in the area. All in all I have only good things to say about this hotel and

For business or pleasure, Sheraton Hotel Lagos is a promise kept in terms of quality service, comfort and stylish luxury. It is strategically located a good distance from the local and international airport along Ikeja, Lagos. No two visits are the same.

I was here for two nights in business. The hotel had a live band and the service by the bar outside was great. My bed was comfortable and the room was quiet the ac blows cold. I ordered fish and chips and it was tasty. The staff is very helpful and kind. On each floor there is usually a security guard and they are friendly and that made me feel safe. The pooled looked nice but I didn't get a chance to lay out. They really make you feel at home here.

Review Title: Oasis of calm with a great Nigerian flavour
Review Text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton Lagos last week. The top couple of floors have recently been renovated but I was below these floors and it was still very comfortable. I had a lovely view of the pool and my room was well appointed.   On Friday and Saturday nights the place goes off with a live band in the courtyard near the pool. I enjoyed the entertainment but it was quite loud in my room. If you are staying the weekend and you prefer peace and quiet, I would advise asking for a room on the other side of the hotel.   I thoroughly enjoyed the pool, pool bar and restaurant. They had a delicious snack menu including Mezze plate and fresh pizzas. The breakfast and lunch buffets were absolutely wonderful with a great selection of Nigerian foods such as Dodo, Moin Moin,

Review Title: WOW and experience of a lifetime!
Review Text: After checking out of another hotel prematurely I decided on the Sheraton and this was one of the best decisions I ever made.  From the moment I arrived the level of service I received was just incredible.  The various restaurants and bars on the premises make you feel as if you are at a holiday resort.  The food, especially the buffet is of the highest standards and offer a huge variety,  This hotel make you forget that you are in the middle of Lagos!

Review Title: Great hotel and friendly helpful staff
Review Text: Hotel has great amenities and very helpful and friendly staff. My only disappointment was the SPG awards program that did not honor my 8 night stay as I had made my booking on booking.com. What kind of award program credits you for who you book with rather than your loyalty to the hotel chain. I am no longer a loyal SPG customer but I will stay at this hotel again.

We stayed as part of a British Council group visit.  The rooms were extremely  comfortable well equipped with everything that we could possibly want.  The only slight irritation (and it was slight) was that one of two UK plug sockets did not work and the other was a little temperamental.    Beds were amazingly comfortable and the pillows were possibly the best pillows I have ever experienced,  The staff were very welcoming and the food was excellent both at breakfast and dinner.  The location was great for travelling into Lagos (Lagos traffic is an experience all of its own)  We felt very safe and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
Review Text

This was my second visit. This hotel is very secure with a guarded gate checking all vehicles plus individual scanning to enter the building. The hotel is a bit old but renovation is on its way. Rooms are OK with very comfortable beds. Breakfast is great, the restaurants OK. There is a pool.

Review Title: Great staff, time for a refresh
Review Text: Firstly it's the people that make this hotel, everyone does their best to make you feel welcome. Security is good, both at the entrance and with staff on guest floors. The rooms are tired, bathrooms poor. The wall tiles were cracked and the towels thread bare. The room itself is a good size, bed very comfortable allowing me to sleep well. The large modern tv is a bonus, but apart from the news channels not a great deal of choice. The meeting room we used on the 1st floor was large and well equipped. The wifi is charged, but works well, there were numerous power cuts during my stay, but this is to be expected.

The hotel is well positioned close to the airport. The rooms area good size with comfortable beds. The decor is tired and desperately needs updating, especially the bathrooms. The public facilities are good with a great swimming pool and two tennis courts and a reasonable gym. sadly the excellent Indian restaurant closed down and was replaced with an Italian which is almost always deserted. most people eat outside. prices are on the steep side for average cuisine. Again the quality of the food has gone down in recent months especially the steaks. The staff are excellent and always greet you as a long lost friend. I understand the hotel is undergoing some redevelopment with the top 2 floors being refurbished first. Hopefully these rooms will be an improvement.

The meals and level of customer service are fantastic. I am here for 6 nights and feel extremley safe and looked after. Security at the gate is very good and can seen all around the hotel. Certain nights of the week they have BBQs by the pool bar which are great.  I would defenately reccomend this hotel

Rooms are a good size, clean and with staff on each floor I felt reasonably safe.   Goodies bar was staffed by a chap that was falling asleep in front of us!  Room service menu fairly mediocre, I ordered the burger but tasted really odd and so I didn't eat it.   Power cuts here seem to be frequent.   TV has lots of channels but many are scrambled. So bring an iPad!

It was that time of year, Harmattan delayed all the flights so I missed my International flight. I tried a few hotels which are normally fully booked on a Friday. Sheraton had space, I arrived and was pleasantly and very efficiently assisted at the front desk. Well done Ojo.  Rooms are clean, neat and tidy. Hot water, decent internet and a comfortable bed. The bar service was just as good kust Bert expensive. Wake up call was on time. Check out was quick and efficient. Transport had been arranged as per my request the evening before. I was very impressed with the friendliness and efficiency of the staff. Well done.

Best for safety with most major flight crews using the hotel. Good buffet for breakfast and dinner. Staff are truly friendly and helpful. Gym is great, but not much else to do. Electricity cuts often in the area, but the hotel is equipped with generators that kick in and at times you never notice the difference.

Review Title: Probably the best hotel in Ikeja
Review Text: It's proximity to the airport and other locations in Ikeja are a huge plus for the hotel, close by you can find a lot of restaurants including a fantastic chinese one called golden zen that had some of the best food I have ever had in Nigeria (I will review that separately). Food was also delicious and the staff were courteous and helped me out a bit. I am only concerned now because they haven't refunded me some money but that's a separate issue. Nice place overall if you're avoiding the Island

Review Title: One of the best hotels in Lagos
Review Text: Nice hotel in the middle of the chaos in the city of Lagos. It's very near the airport and that makes it very convenient. The hotel smells humid from the corridors to the rooms. The service is a bit slow, but it comes with the culture. If you give them time, they will find solutions for you. I would not recommend the room service menu, but the area is pretty dangerous and sometimes after a long day at work there is no other option. The gym and pool facilities are nice enough. The best thing about this hotel is that is very safe, so is worth to pay the price.

Did not stay at the Sheraton but had an occasional dinner at the hotel this visit.  Decided on Italian for the night. Was initially put off as "patronage was low". Decided nevertheless to have some anti and pasto-pasta. but ate in the Lobby Bar/Lounge.  Food was great well cooked - actually complemented the chef - have visited many an Italian restaurant in my time - today pasta was great & service with teh usual smile.  Small music combo entertaining in the Lobby Bar, background laid back live music.  "Mr Barry" this may attract further custom (in addition to usual entertainment at the Pool Terrace.
Review Text

This hotel is not great but serves its purpose. Was clean and comfy although it was a little out dated. Unfortunately the upper floor restaurant was closed when I was there but the food around the place was decent. Had some of the largest prawns I had ever seen there.  Staff were friendly enough but sometimes service was a little slow.  This is a good hotel if you are not on any kind of budget and need to be outside of the island and close to the airport.

I booked Sheraton Lagos through the Agoda website and paid a rather fancy amount of  US $ 836 for 3 nights . I got the confirmation mail  from them that the payment has been made .when I presented it to the hotel they refused to accept it and insisted I pay again.My 3 days were torture with no work done but only tension of how to pay the hotel again.I had to travel to Abuja that evening but could not do so .Several calls to Agoda were met with no response and when they finally took my call in UK they said it has been paid and the hotel is making a mistake.In all this ruckus the hotel started threatening that if i stay beyond 3 pm they will charge me an extra day besides what I already owe them. So I had to make several calls to Indians in Lagos who finally helped to see me

I stayed here with a group of 15 people for business and was really impressed with the facilities, the food and the service. The location on the mainland, near the airport, won't suit everybody but it was fine for us. the hotel property itself felt really spacious with plenty of places in teh lobby and by the pool to congregate for meetings or coffee. the breakfast buffet was stunning, as was dinner buffet. much better than you expect from any hotel food! Staff very courteous and helpful, pool area is nice also. The best bit was actually the rooms -- I See some people on here complaining that the hotel is old but the rooms are very modern with huge comfortable beds and also a good size to the bedroom overall, and a nice desk area. I'd love to stay here again next time I come t

Location is good and close to airport if on a short stay. If doing local business, V.I. is  better area to find hotel. Only if you don't mind endless and horrible traffic jams. Staff is very kind, amendities normal, internet poor (everywhere in NG). Live music at pool Fridays, bring your oww ear plugs unless you want top become deaf!! Breakfast looks plentyful, but it's pretty tasteless. Gym and tenniscourts are non-inviting but security is good, which is needed in Lagos.

We attended an event in this hotel organised by MYKAR from 22nd to 23rd October 2015 were as guest it was tea/coffee break time and we all went for the tea/coffee stand. The hotel staff by name "Rachel" was serving the tea/coffee snack and was virtually throwing the snacks on the plate as though she was feeding dogs, when a participant in in front of me corrected her she took offense and dropped the plate of the lady and did not serve the lady the snacks. Not just that, the same staff when it was time for lunch gave some participants attitude whenever her attention was called and that made most participants avoid her even when she is taking drinks round they refused to call on her to avoid her attitude which is not good for a hotel of this standard. Proper supervision, training

A short visit to Lagos needs a secure hotel. This is it. Check in was friendly enough and I was made to feel welcome. Hotel is very nice with lots of little luxuries. Room was clean with tea facilities and free Wi-Fi. I used room service as I had much to do. Food was delivered fairly quickly and was hot and fresh. Air con in the room was ok but struggled with the heat and humidity. Plenty of free bottled water in'the room. Breakfast was good but expensive unless you are hungry enough to take advantage of the excellent buffet on offer. Check out is easy enough but would be tough if there was more than a couple of people in the queue. The small military unit at the door seems to ensure no issues regarding security are evident. All in all a nice hotel and would use it again.

Started overnight on business.old hotel. The smell of "damp wood permeates the air.the staff was very helpful and friendly. Security on every floor outside the rooms.the beds were comfortable. The food is quite diverse  and Nigeria which allows one to explore local culinary  tastes . wifi  good.all in all reasonable hotel.nothing fancy.

The hotel and restaurants are pricey and service falls below expectation. Restaurant employees lack training which results in slow service.  Was surprised at checkout when found out that a "mandatory" service fee of 10% is added to the advertised and agreed to room rate.

I informed the three ladies behind the reception desk that the ladies toilet was in an unacceptable state to which they apologised and assured me that the matter would be attended to forthwith. I happened to return to those loos 4 hours later to find them in a worse condition. Poor show Sheraton... Particularly when you claim to be a 4 to 5 star hotel and are prepared to charge US$290 per day. My partner and I, as well as other members of our group had endless problems getting in and out of our rooms with the card keys. The restaurant staff were superb and the food pretty good on the whole although quite pricey. Time to shape up Sheraton! You're in an ideal location but offer 2nd class services for 1st class prices!

My second time around but this time with my family. Stayed over a weekend for study purpose and had a relaxing time with my family. Looking forward to my next experience after the ongoing renovations. Food was excellent, location good for flight connections, the beddings, waoh! and the ambience is simply classy.
Review Text

Review Title: Wonderful Service from an Old Building
Review Text: Check-in is usually slow due to the size of the hotel and the high number of guest traffic. I noticed some airline companies do use the hotel and they have to be attended to first. Nevertheless, I was informed of another front office on the 4 floor. The hotel is old, especially the reception, I got to know that it was built in 1985 (30years)  but when it comes to food and service, they are the best in Lagos, 'undisputed'. Their breakfast, lunch and dinner are so on point. Staff are helpful, cheerful and very professional.

It's nice,clean hotel,with friendly,helpful staff.The beds are very confortable.Plenty of channels on the TV,which helps as visitors are not advised to leave the hotel premisses, for safety reasons. The electricity stops quite often,but only for a few seconds at a time.I've been staying at this hotel for many years and they had always this problem,however I don't see it as a big inconvenience. Kettle and coffee filter provided in the room.

This is my third time at the Sheraton and I was glad to see that finally they have started rennovations to the rooms. The staff were polite and willing to help but I was very impressed with the Nektarios and Costas the two chefs. Excellent food and a wecome smile. I will definately reccomend the food to anyone. Keep up the good work and you will definately be my No 1 choice next time I visit Lagos.

Just a normal hotel, not far from the airport good for business trips. Secured and safe. Restaurant was ok bit pricey. Swimming pool is fine to relaxe. I liked the gym and tennis court. I think compare to other hotels in the area its still good.

Review Title: A bit old but a reliable hotel in Lagos
Review Text: I've stayed at the Sheraton many times for work. Although the hotel is old, they're doing some renovations and I'm sure the rooms will look fantastic in the near future. The service is usually good and the staff are friendly and professional. They recognize me everytime I'm back and that is always a sign of attentive customer service.  The pool area is nice and good for laps or sunbathing. The restaurant by the pool is very pleasant and always lively at night. They have a very good live band every Friday which plays excellent music (soul, rnb, nigerian, etc...).

Review Title: An oasis of calm in a hustling, bustling city.
Review Text: Spent a weekend here reconnecting with my husband who works in Nigeria.  Our room was clean, spacious and comfortable. The bed was cloudlike, and the linens were of good quality. The staff was extremely gracious, and went out of their way to be accommodating. There is good security from the time you enter the hotel grounds until you leave the premises.  The common areas (lobby, lounges, pool area etc) were very attractive and well designed-you could find a little private area if you desired, as well as areas where larger groups could congregate. There were two little shops on site where you could purchase toiletries, souvenirs, etc, as well as a buffet style restaurant, an Italian restaurant, ala carte service at both the lobby lounge and the pool lounge, and a very nice

This is my first time to Sheraton Lagos, and the main reason i used it is due to its proximity to airport which is approx 20 mns. And i have to say this is a life saver wth Lagos traffic. When you arrive its an ok Lobby with welcoming spaces however the staff is little slow in checking you in i think there is a room for improvement in this. Room space is great , quality of furniture is average. Tv signal quality defiantly needs improvement. Also the food is ok however the main restaurant staff really need some lifting up  specially the couple of times they put for me staned table cloths.  some lifting up

I didn't actually stay at the hotel, but went for dinner one night to the Crockpot Restaurant, for their buffet. I don't know if I can start on the desserts...but the hot pineapple crumble was amazing! They have an area of the buffet for salads, another with breads, the mains include meats, vegetables, stew, soups, potatoes, and a small section with a roast meat...and then the desserts. The ambience is good, the restaurant looks out on the poolside restaurant, and the large lounge area in the foyer is also another good spot to sit with a drink!

Good location. Not fare from airport. It's a safe place also. Rooms are basic. Flat screen TV, safety box, ref.....etc.No shower cabin available. The room have only bath hub. Internet is working but not good. Renovation(hammering) in the Hotel is ongoing. I could not rest/sleep when i arrived in the afternoon from the airport. Outdoor pool is there. Also the personal is very friendly. But compare for the price you pay(USD 370) i can get a better Hotel. Hotel is overpriced. Even the restaurant is overpriced. Good to stay short time only. For long time is to expensive.

Well secured hotel, with very good facilities and friendly helpful staff. the rooms have been refurbished which is a great improvement. every day between 17:00 and 19:00 happy hour for SPG members (Free drinks), Friday live music at the pool bar in great setting. Restaurants have a good choice.
Review Text

Stay at this hotel for biz trip as recommend by our friend, since it is safest hotel for us two ladies. Many airline also stay at this hotel, so we think is good. Breakfast food quite many option, and you can try on local food, also fresh fruit. the hotel its self quite old, got good location near city centre, also you can find next door chinese restaurant.

Staff attitude has changed a lot. they try to be friendly and helpful. The hotel should be some 40+ years old and it shows. At 8.30PM, while checking in the room was being cleaned. they sell half day rooms to make addl revenue, which hurts customers who check in in the night after a long flight. the rooms smelled of some chemical and was wet and slippery. the aircon would not work. we got stuck in the lift. all this at some USD260/night. better options such as protea or ibis goes for half less than half the price. noise from corridor could be heard in the room.

On my personal scale this gets a 3 for Average. Can't think of anything that especially impressed me...was distinctly underwhelmed by the buffet (both breakfast & dinner) which made up in quantity what it lacked in inspiring flavor.  On the up side the place is somehow familiar & reasonably secure. The staff attentive & whilst they may not always be able to deliver on a request, they are friendly.  If you are not tone deaf beware the lounge singer - she's a real treasure!

Stayed here for business as it was close to our business partners' office, for 4 days.   Very secure, friendly staff and helpful too.   The pool side bar is lovely location and a stress buster, lovely pool, plenty of parking spaces, lovely bed, bath and the corridors may require some makeover. Breakfast has ample options, vegetarians. Italian restaurant and a couple of other restaurants and bar in the hotel will take care of your craving.  Overall a good experience. The only flip side is the Hotel rates are a little on the higher side.

Review Title: Business in the a Third World
Review Text: It's about the best your going to do in Lagos. The food is safe, water is questionable. Stay in the hotel or have a guide. Room was clean and staff were friendly. The bar / lounge is a great place to water down and talk to folks from everywhere. The country has a lot to offer, this hotel is the Taj if you must visit.

nice hotel for the sunday afternoon chill at the poohl with some fingerfood and drinks. friday nights there is a live band out side, the irish pub inside is small but ok, staff is friendly and food is ok but expensive.

Comfortable rooms, free wi-fi and a buffet breakfast, which includes Bloody Mary as an option! We felt secure and the hotel staff were always prepared to answer any questions and help wherever they could. Close to Murtala Muhammed Airport.

Review Title: A reliable and comfortable experience in Lagos...
Review Text: The Sheraton Hotel is well-equipped and friendly. The food is superb and the rooms are comfortable... The restaurant has buffets and professional chefs. My family's favourite dishes are the pizza, pasta, buffet and sirloin steak. There is free wifi in the lobby, however the wifi in the room is at a reasonable price. The hotel is also very close to be airport.

This property is 38 years old therefore is a large property. The sheer size provides an enhanced level of security that's reassuring when staying in the city.  The hotel is near the airport and had a large number of foreigners staying at the property.   The room facilities are as you would expect, the only downside is the washrooms need refurbishing particularly the floor.  Restaurant buffet was at par with most international hotels.  Staff are friendly however the check-in staff are slow and it can take you up to 15 minutes to check-in.  Overall a comfortable stay and would definitely return to the property in the future.

Review Title: Hotel with comfort and perfect for families
Review Text: Sheraton Hotel is one of the main hotels in the heart of Lagos in Ikeja, the location of the Hotel makes it an ideal place for travelers due to the proximity of the Airport and also to various leisure destinations, Ikeja Golf course is a short distance from the hotel, shopping malls and night clubs.
Review Text

this Sheraton requires a full refurb, very tired & tatty throughout but it  provides the high level of security required in lagos. Many power cuts, often questionable water. Wifi, fridge & iron in room. Friendly staff, food average & expensive. Night workers frequent the bar.

Review Title: Super location, and great outdoor spaces...
Review Text: Not in the city, but very well placed to catch up a plane than hotels on Victoria Island. Great garden; good pool; good restaurants; friendly staff; nice lobby with singer. Very relaxing in Lagos' urban chaos. I only had a meeting and ate there this time, but I liked the place and will probably stay there next time I am in town.

Review Title: Over priced but good hotel in lagos
Review Text: The Sheraton Lagos overall is a good hotel. Close to the airport but traffic congestion is a factor.   Rooms AC works very well. Good water pressure. Bottled water provided daily. Flat screen TV, fridge in room. Bed comfortable. You can hear most movements from hallway and the room next door. Room is spacious  Wifi, Worked very well in lobby and in room. Did not have good range at the gym.  Food Only had fries and chicken wings which were delicious however overpriced. Other in my group ate at the different restaurants and while the food was good, it was pricey. Around the corner on the Same street the Protea is located is quite a few restaurants including local and chinese cuisine. There is also a supermarket in the plaza next door to the hotel. If you are adventurous you would

Though is been here for quite a while, the ambience and cleanliness is still so good. The location close to the airport is just ideal for an early morning flight. The room is large enough and the bed is hmmm! Not too impressed with the towels as I think they should be replaced.

Dread coming here...can't wait to get out!! As soon as you arrive you get smells of sewage and poor/old air conditioning system. The room pricing is no reflection of what you get... The reality is out dated and dirty

Review Title: Safe and secure but nothing special at the present time.
Review Text: An acceptable business hotel for a few nights. The staff are helpful and try hard to please. The small pub like bar needs modernising and the main bar lacks atmosphere. The pool bar serves good evening food but it would better if it stayed open beyond 22.00.  As the management has stated the refurbished bedrooms are very acceptable, those that have not yet been updated are very tired.

I have been staying here for 20 odd years because the company I work for has a contract with this hotel.  The hotel has continued to improve during this time; the rooms are much better and so is the food. Power outages occur throughout the day, but so do they in Abuja and many other countries in Africa, and only usually last for several minutes, and serve to remind us how lucky we are and how much we take for granted! The staff do their best given the resources at hand. The pool area is pleasant and the gym is well equipped. The wonderful people of Nigeria always make me feel welcome!

I have stayed at this hotel for over 10 years but i like it!!! Gum is very well equipped and has some great air con. Tennis with the tennis pro is always cheap and fun. Rooms are a bit tired but i have always slept well but it is important to get on that does not look over the pool side as there is often quite a raucous band at night!!! Lobby bar a bit pokey but quite often shows live football and beer is cold, although quite expensive. Always have enjoyed the food but would recommend you eat out by the pool and take a book as the service is very African!! Internet is woeful so don't build you hopes up!! Check out can be a bit of a painful experience so do not do in a hurry! After all the the staff are very friendly and i always come away feeling happy with my experience but

This hotel is by far the best "western" style hotel in the area, and was clean and had a nice pool area.  But the power went out at least 10-15 times during my two nights there, which was a bit disconcerting, especially when in the elevator!  Plus it was very pricey for what I would consider an average Sheraton. If I could have found another hotel, I definitely would have moved.

Review Title: Average, I would choose not to stay here
Review Text: Very unusual hotel, it needs a total renovation. It's tired and it does smell of damp.   Unfortunately in the West we are spoilt and use to a certain standard. Although tonight I had room service pizza. It was very good and the waiter staff were friendly and attentive.   It's a shame as I think the staff would love to have a new hotel, environment to be proud of.   Wifi is good, no movies or on demand. It's true about the water, it's brown when you run a bath, just don't have one! lol   The room is clean, bedding satisfactory, clean towels it's just the overall feel that makes it feel dirty, it's not.   Coffee in the rooms, fridge etc. usual SPG toiletries.   The hard working class of this country are trying hard, this hotel is not exquisite but it's not awful either.
Review Text

Review Title: nice location. away from city traffic to airport
Review Text: Being a SPG group, one may expect more.. The rooms (even club one that I stayed) are very basic. Big property and renovation started. I suppose after renovation it will be far better. Big lobby too but old fashioned and darker. the same group hotel Four points in Lagos island has vibrant colors and lobby is enjoying sun light. But city traffic starting as soon as 3 pm is killing your day from Lagos Island to Lagos city.. breakfast buffet is very reach. (not in lounge)

Review Title: Yet again rooms not ready for check in at 9pm
Review Text: When I try to check in to a hotel around 21:00 on a pre-booked reservation, I fully expect the room to be ready.  As is becoming the norm, room is never ready as hotel allows day use of the room to airline staff which only check out around 20:30 then the rooms have to be cleaned and turned over.  Considering the price paid for an overnight stay, it is not good enough that evening guests whom have been travelling for 12/13 hours are made to wait in hotel lobby/smoky bar whilst room is serviced.  Protea or Novotel are two decent local choices which I would rather use as service standard and room is better

Review Title: Nice Place, Don't Think I'd Visit Again
Review Text: I typically stay on Victoria Island when I stay in Lagos, as there are a number of very nice hotels there. This time I had an early morning flight back to Abuja the next day, so I decided to try the Sheraton which is close to the Airport.  It started badly - when I arrived at 9am, immediately the clerk wanted to charge $80 for "early check-in". Apparently the fact that they might have to clean a room warrants an $80 charge. He didn't say "we don't have rooms available" (which turned out to be the case), he wanted $80. I went to my office and checked in after 2pm.  When I got back, the staff was very very nice. Very pleasant and professional. It made me begin to forget the earlier interaction, and the manager was particularly kind to us. I got a decent room, but the whole hotel

I've stayed here many times as it's my companies choice for business visits.  I expect it costs them more here than other countries as choice is limited. The reception staff always smiling & always helpful.   I always self cater as there are fridges in the room, kettles & coffee machines.  So fresh milk, M&S salads & sandwiches always in my suitcase!!  I usually only stay one night so it's ok. The rooms are ok, beds very comfortable with white linen, duvet & longer length comfy pillows.  It is cleaned to a good standard, although hot bedded.  The Bathrooms are the worst I've ever seen!  but there is plenty of good pressure & hot water if you don't mind the brown tinge.  The Bath tub isn't at all inviting so I've never used it!    The floors are laminate which is a silly choice

lovely hotel well run and u dont know which country ur in when u go behind the gates and enjoy the differnt bars  its total escapism after being in downtown nigeria ,it neeeds some help with standars of manners was only comment as african influence still there

I have stayed in the Hotel several times. However on this occasion I noticed the room has been renovated. The location of the hotel to the airport is about 30minues. The front office staffs are very welcoming, warm, and friendly. The food is excellent and there is a wonderful variety on the buffet for breakfast and evening meals. I would recommend the hotel to anyone for a totally warm holiday it has top class security and a very friendly atmosphere.

Hotel runs hot beds policy.Room modern enough with a safe, kettle, coffee maker, desk and chair. Bed comfortable enough, although I had forgotten how small a single bed is. Rooms have been revamped. Water still a little yellow when you run it into the sink. Toilet stained with yellow water!! Hotel has armed guards around grounds. Swimming pool clean, large sun area with outside dinning very noisy with I think it was air conditioning units! These must have been from other building as aircon not great in room all or nothing. Staff friendly enough. Although not overwhelmingly so. Hotel close to airport. Renovations still going on all day 9 till 5.

I gave 4/5, comparing to other Africa hotels. If this was in another region, it might only be a 3  Good 1. Beds. Soft and comfy. 2 choices of pillows. Have an undersheet too 2. AC works 3. Hot water, hot. Good shower pressure and doesn't take forever to become hot 4. Food at pool bar came out quick 5. Free internet is ok for basic email/browsing 6. Nice gardens and trees 7. Gym is ok for a hotel gym, some cardio and weight machines, plus free weights. AC works in the gym! 8. Checkout time/speed, ok  No so great 1. Service is a bit slow in the restaurants 2. Buffet does not get replenished quick enough 3. Lifts a bit slow 4. Tea and coffee stations in the room. Very limited choice 5. The place is looking a little bit tired but that adds a bit of charm 6. Checkin a bit slow 7.

Good 5 star hotel.  I arrived at 12 noon. They didn't have a room so they offered lunch ☺ Good service Breakfast ok Helpful staff Far from Lagos island Request airport pickup. Be aware you have to take a bus to get to car  Nothing else to say

I've been a regular here for years. Most of the time I only visit the buffet, grab a bite and head to the airport. The last time I was here we were without power in the restaurant for about 10 minutes. no ac, no candles just darkness. A hotel of this stature ought to do better. The evening buffet had a large selection, but all the food was poorly prepared. most of the items were overcooked and really tough. They had a crepe station that looked great but tasted pretty bad. The caramel had a really bad after taste.  They upgraded the public bathrooms downstairs which was a pleasant surprise. unfortunately the room rates are still sky high. I am no longer forced to patronize the hotel since there are several new hotels that have propped up in the area. i hope the competition will
Review Text

I am now 9 days into severe food poisoning that occurred from eating a burger at the pool bar. I have been twice to this hotel now and the first time I experienced rude staff, this has improved. The food looks gorgeous, smells lovely and is presented well. As soon as I arrived back into the UK I had severe cramps and other symptoms that I do not wish to share. Once the Dr visited me and diagnosed the problem she came to the conclusion that the last thing I ate was a burger that was undercooked, poor hygiene by staff and now I'm still suffering with severe cramps still. Advice to travellers, please don't be put off by the hotel as it's safe just eat everything piping hot, if it doesn't burn your tongue don't eat it. My food was cold. Dreadful.

I have being to this hotel many times and it was always ok. The rooms are ok, good TV program and the staff is friendly. The pool is nice, a lot of space around to relax. The gym is small but ok. I think the best about this stay here is always the steak, it's very good quality! The internet is very stable the electricity is not, many time a day there is a power cut, but never for long. It's a good hotel and I always enjoy my stay there.

Old hotel, they have tried to renovate it, however the fixes are evident. extremely overpriced. only upside it one need not go all the way to victoria island if you are on a stopover between flights(which i was). friendly staff. bathroom is cramped. bed is good quality.

Cons:  - incredibly overpriced (but then again everything in Lagos is) - horrible bathrooms that need renovation - I could hear the people in the room above me  Pros: - Excellent service. Everyone who worked there was wonderful and accommodating. - Rooms (except bathrooms) have been renovated and are comfortable

The hotel is located in a secure compound, with sport facilities such as Swimming pool,Tennis, running track, and Gym. There are a number of good quality Resteraunt options, Naturally be careful of the Buffet food which is not hot, we did loose one of out team to a stomach problem for several days after eating at the Buffet. Also do not be surprised when eating by the pool in the evening to see very large Rats (10cm plus!!!!) running around the edge of the wall and flower beds. The hotel customers are Business and Flight Crew, some of the flight crew do like to start parties at 1 am with little to no consideration for other guests, my experience with a British Airways crew kept me awake until past 3 am and required a formal complaint to the manager to resolve.
