Rooms are old, furniture partly broken, carpet worn down. Smell in the rooms is muddy. Pool is ok as well as the small gym. Service in the bars and Restaurants is even worse than the low african standard. They do not notice new customers, some are unfriendly and I was for instance served a salad at the pool not with the 1000 Island dressing that is in the menu but instead without any dressing and was asked what I do when I was at least looking for oil and vinegar.

Had an extended stay here in November for business.  I can say at the outset, that my stay here was very good.  I understand that there is a major renovation going on, on the upper floors of the hotel, and am looking forward to my next stay to hopefully see the improvements that have been made.   I was staying in a Sheraton Club room, so check in on the 4th floor was very efficient.  As was the case with almost all of my interactions with the staff of the hotel, the staff upon check in were extremely welcoming and friendly. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable and I must give credit to the housekeeping staff during my entire stay.  They always ensured the room was clean, and were very willing to respond to any requests or questions I had.  My room had obviously been

Had dinner recently at the Sheraton, pre Lufthansa flight.  Other than the hotel suffering an electrical  breaker issue it served an excellent hamburger. Like all of Lagos , extremely expensive, but sitting out poolside is a nice evening.  So if you find yourself in that crazed city called Lagos, treat yourself. I did not stay, but heard the rooms are not great and at $500US + per night, might be better options, but as I said, lagos is extremely expensive

Comparing this hotel to what you will find in the US or Europe is not a helpful benchmark. It is very expensive for what you get.... very, very expensive. Set that to one side - I found the room to be clean and comfortable - bed was as good as you will find anywhere in terms of support and providing a good nights sleep. Shower worked well. AC worked OK. Service and food was of good standard. Staff were friendly. Nothing is done at pace, but it did get done.  Did the job I needed it to do

Sheraton should remove this place from its listing Does not warrant the name Sheraton  The dirtiest hotel I ever had the misfortune to stay Rooms were disguting (Had 3 before I found one almost liveable) Carpets filthy, Furniture worn out, Matress disgusting, Dirty Sheets, Toilet a disgrace, bathroom worn out, shower did not work (2 rooms) AC useless Total lack of maintenence although charging top rates - overpriced at over $200 per night Food overpriced and very average (Club Sandwich $35 - cheapest thing on menu) Will never stay again thankfully I was not paying
Review Text

It's a historic location and has been around for quite a while. Still can be relied on for some decent food but the alcohol here is VERY expensive. old school restaurant brings that back all sorts of memories but it's definitely in need of a refresh/ refurb. Visit if you're in the area and aren't planning to drink much alcohol. I didn't stay here btw just came to relax for a few hours with friends.

Review Title: Old & tired hotel, but service is good
Review Text: I had a three night stay at the Sheraton, and according to the staff I was in one of the upgraded rooms. The room is comfortable and spacious, however the bathroom looks like it was left behind in the 80's.  Overall the experience was reasonably good, the service made up for the fact that the hotel is badly in need of an upgrade. The protea across the road is streets ahead in terms of look & feel.  As with most hotels in Lagos, food and drinks are pricey.

One of the best place far from home in Lagos. Rooms are clean and the hotel feels safe and secure. Helpful service from the staff, club lounge brings a comfortable plus. Food in the hotel restaurants is good with attentive service.

stayed at this hotel mouldy ceilings dirt & grime everywhere  virgin crew moved out of here a year ago and I now know why  filthy pigs this place needs closing down its a health risk !  staff are all watching your valuable possessions when checking in  pool is dirty  sheraton head office should visit this dump and close it down

Review Title: One of the Best Hotels in Lagos
Review Text: I stayed in this hotel for 2 weeks in June.  It's a large hotel with lots of different bars and restaurants, health club/gym and out importantly its secure.  For those who book a club room or have the level on SPG there is also a club lounge offering breakfast and evening snacks and drinks.  on checkin the reception are very helpful although things take time in Nigeria.  The hallways always have a damp smell to them but this is due to the climate.  The rooms are very nice done to a good standard.  WIFI Internet is free all throughout the hotel.  There is also a nice pool area to relax around.  The restaurants all serve a huge choice of food all done to a very good standard.  Overall I would stay at this hotel again and recommend it to anyone wishing to stay in Lagos.  The

Considering the country this Sheraton exceeds expectations. The general feel is English colonial, the hotel is showing its age but has not lost its charm. The Staff are friendly and Helpful, Restaurants provide a good range of food from simple snacks to high quality cuisine. Security which is an important factor in this city, appears to be adequate. Rooms are spacious and well equipped.

Had a short but very pleasant overnight stay here.  It's an older hotel, the bathroom in particular is very dated, and unfortunately wasn't as clean as it could be (previous guests hairs in the bath).  The hotel also smells of damp which isn't a very welcoming first impression. Laminate floor in the bedroom was chipped in places and I didn't want to walk on it with bare feet! There is ongoing work to refurbish areas so perhaps all these areas will be addressed.   More than making up for these things though, elevating the hotel score, are a team of really superb staff.  They all are so friendly and helpful and their massive smile is genuine. So refreshing to see.   Air con in the rooms was superb, really powerful. Wifi also free and fast, it never dropped out. Had lunch in the

My initial impression of the country did not give me high expectations for the hotel. However the Sheraton is everything you would expect with this chain. Security is good. Rooms spacious clean and everything works. Staff friendly and professional.  I would stay here again.

Not up to standards of Sheratons in other parts of he world. But, for West Africa, quite nice. The rooms are going through renovation and the old carpeting is being replaced with laminate. The bathroom fixtures are still very outdated. This trip I experienced no rolling blackouts which were quite common several years ago.  The food at the outdoor Tiki bar is quite good and the staff in all areas are superb.

Stayed here about 20 times with work, friendly staff and really good food, the buffalo wings and club sandwich is worth having, the hotel hallways are tired but the rooms have been refurbished and are comfortable with free Wi-fi
Review Text

I've stayed at this hotel about 9 times it's always hard work to get the SPG points added emailing off bills etc. The rooms are tired but some have are being refurbished with nice TV's and beds. The pool area is good at this hotel and tennis courts are a nice touch. The night club is one of those places you need to see just once that's all I shall say on that matter. Staff do the best they can but tend to fail to find solutions to problems.

Close to the airport, it's handy for early morning flights. The hotel room was clean but very tired and in need of an overhaul. I have to say the staff were very friendly and the security guard was most concerned and made sure I knew our company driver who came to take me to the airport.

I heard terrible review from this hotel so I was prepared for the worst. But at the end hotel was not too bad. It's Lagos so straight away the fences around the hotel with the guards with AK-47 does not scream welcome but it's Nigeria and it's like that....... Quick check in but be prepare for a very slow check out!! They having trouble to find your bill and check properly the amount that you have to pay... Bed is very comfy and room are very quiet. Shower as standard and amenities as well. I'm guessing all the person who will read this review don't go there for holiday and might not choose the hotel but maybe their company will.

Review Title: Not what you'd expect from a Sheraton
Review Text: Not up to the usual Sheraton standards, but you are in Nigeria. Rooms have had a recent makeover - but you can't escape the musty damp smell of West Africa! Good breakfast. Beware Lagos traffic. If you have to catch a flight and are staying in Victoria Island you can easily miss it. The Sheraton is pretty close to the airport which is a plus. Take lots of USD cash if you want to avoid credit card fraud. Its alright really considering the megatropolis of Lagos !

Very good service but slow check-in... Breakfast was good but not exceedingly opulent. Good rooms with comfy beds. Large outdoor pool with a good bar area, both inside and outside the building. Haven't cheked other facilities. 30min from the airport. 20-80 min to downtown by taxi - depending on traffic.

Sheraton by name but not so good inside.  I got room on top floor and club access. Room was average and smelt strongly of damp.  No fridge in room and A/C was very poor.  Its very old this place, a shed lot of money to stay too.  Staff very pleasant, pool is lovely and in-house driver was great.  Will try 4Points next time and compare.

Rooms are rather clean, very oldfashioned bathroom, rooms are very loud, not enough programms on the television. Staff is very friendly and helpfull. Swimmingpool is poor. Poolbar is cosy. Roomservice is ok .... Definately not worth the name sheraton

We visit and stay in the sheraton several times a season. Our past stay at the hotel ,we got one of the newly remodeled rooms pool side. As always the room was spotless and really nicely remodeled. Plenty of drawer and counter space to spread out. The wet bar/sink is a nice touch that seems to be in all the remodeled rooms. The pools, grounds and arcade areas are well kept up and inviting. We will for sure to be back again sometime in future

This is a nice hotel fairly close to the airport, wíth a good service and great breakfirst. The poolbar serves good pizza and the buffet with Nigerian food can be recommended. For more European style food use the Italian restaurant. The hotel bar is often full and they are showing sport on the wide screen

Review Title: Nice hotel for Nigeria, a bit far from downtown
Review Text: When traveling to Lagos and Nigeria in general, hotel selection is critical. So many places look nice on their websites only to turn out to be rundown, dangerous snake pits. Fortunately, the Sheraton is as nice as it appears in the pictures and is one of the best in Lagos.  The hotel is about 20-30 minutes drive from the airport depending on traffic. To downtown, it can easily be an hour or more by road, especially if commuting during rush hours. If your work is taking you into downtown, you might want to consider something a bit closer.   Like most high end Nigerian hotels, the Sheraton is surrounded by high walls with plenty of security guards on site. The staff in general seem to take their work very seriously, which after having worked in Nigeria for a month was a very
Review Text

Review Title: Rooms need to be cleaned thoroughly
Review Text: Hotel/room had a funny damp sort of smell, electricity kept turning on and off several times throughout my stay, bathroom not cleaned properly. Did not feel comfortable in my stay at all. However, staff were friendly and always greeting.

1) Good  and professional Check-In. 2) Introduction to the facilities. 3) Great pool area and Pool bar. 4) Excellent dinner options near the pool area for dinner ( Value for money buffet and Al la cart. 5) Room service delivery and attitude of staff towards service was outstanding.  6) Speed of delivery for room service was GREAT! 7) Hi- Speed Internet.  Out of all that I would really emphasis on the optimistic service attitude that the staff carries, I was surprised that they have such an organized F&B flow in their daily operation.   This was outstanding and did not expected this at all..  Would love to be there again and I do suggest to try this place.  Thank you for the great stay.  Prashant Upadhyay  Room 151

Review Title: If you want to feel like you are in USA though reality is Lagos, you got to stay here.
Review Text: This Sheraton is most advanced and well organized one in Nigeria. I didn't feel any difference with other Sheraton of Europe and USA. Spaceful lobby and international breakfast, 5 star restaurant. If you are Gold SPG, you are committed by this Sheraton  maximum accomodation and attendance(Late check out etc)

Close to midnight my flight got cancelled at Lagos and the airline sent us to a hotel. For whatever reason I was so uncomfortable there that I  HAD to move and so I called up the Sheraton. I did not have my passport also with me. When I explained my situation to the person at the reception Mr. David he was so courteous and more importantly he ensured that I felt safe and calm.  David said he would send me a car to pick me up and since he could not get the direction to where I was I took a taxi and went to the hotel at around 1 AM in the night.  The moment I reached the reception David came across to greet me and ensure that I felt safe and relaxed, got me a room and after I had settled down again called me to check out that I was doing OK and now that I was in the Sheraton not

Sheraton might be a bit pricy but for a hotel in Nigeria, it offers decent service and facilities. I have stayed here on a number of occasion and one thing that struck me was the fact that the Management listens. I stayed here once and when I complained about the Internet, the Management responded to my email apologizing for the difficulty experienced. This was impressive...

For Lagos a pretty good hotel ... well protected by guards ( which is necessary ) reception is very slow when checking out so don't think you can do that last moment before you leave....  Breakfast is fine with enough choise ... Staff kicks you out of the breakfast room when you are still talking after breakfast opening hours ... Breakfast ist till 10.30 hrs ... We were talking till 10.40 hrs and requested to leave. Hotelbar is small, although there is another one in the lobby and also near the pool ( closes very early ) Food is a bit above average but probabely good for African Nigerian Standards. Water is not drinkable. Lots of Musquito's in the evening. Rooms are good, beds sleep fine, enough towels, good internet.

I've stayed here a couple of times and it's not a bad option. The hotel is typical of many older Sheraton hotels, typified by a concrete structure and red neon Sheraton sign that probably has one light not working.  The lobby area has plentiful seating, a bar and TVs showing whatever sport is going on. The outdoor bar and pool area isn't bad and overall it feels quite safe with plenty of security after dark.   As with most of Lagos, power can be an issue so don't rely on the bedside clock radio for a wake-up call!

Review Title: Poor security, smelly and overpriced; avoid!
Review Text: First things first: this is not a part of the Sheraton Hotel chain, it just uses the name. Secondly, for a city where high rates of crime are a problem and terrorism is a credible risk this hotel has terrible security. Poor anti-terrorism measues, no spy holes or chains on doors, weak locks etc. The lobby is full of loiterers and prositutes and the hotel has no car pool.   The hotel also smells of mould (I gather there is a problem with the aircon system) and the sheets curtains etc in the rooms smell and feel damp. The rooms also smell of cigarettes and have very tired decor. There are no balconys and many of the windows do not open.   The food is average for a hotel in Lagos (ie not great) but at least there are a number of options.   The hotel is massively overpriced.

Review Title: Reasonable Hotel but not the normal Sheraton standard
Review Text: I have stayed at this hotel a few times for business over the past few months. The rooms are reasonable and clean. The Italian restaurant is good. Eating at the pool bar is also good. The service is friendly. It is fine for a business hotel but does not have the edge that you expect from the Sheraton brand.

Second review for Sheraton in just 2 months . Last time I wrote comments on bathroom cleanliness and towels but this time was perfect . No complain at all , bathroom was cleaned and provided all necessary stuff required. Food was excellent as usual and spend most of time at pool bar , enjoying beer and sheesha with friend . Very nice place to stay.
Review Text

Coincidentally celebrating the year of 2014 in Lagos. Sheraton Hotel as usual did not get me disappointed. The hotel arranged a special party for all guests to celebrate 2014! Everyone was gathered, singing, eating and sharing the feelings.   Must try

The hotel has in an in room Wifi plus all areas of the hotel has wireless coverage. I had travelled across Nigeria and I have-not  seen any better connection.  The hotel's proximity to the airport is very good; but Lagos has changed a lot, one should not mind going down to the island hotels.

i have stayed in Sheraton Lagos with my colleagues for overnight . Sheraton hotel in Lagos is having decent swimming pool and most of the times pool occupied by airlines staff all over the world. they have nice buffet restaurant, Italian and some other restaurant. very nice indoor and outdoor bar near swimming pool. staff i have find all times very a helpful. i had lunch and dinner in crocket restaurant and it was delicious and wide variety of choices are available . i just like to advise management to improve room cleanliness . room i have stayed bathroom was not cleaned properly and wash basin was blocked and water was flooding over sink. only large towel was provided , i could not found small towel in wash room nor in living room.  i will definitely recommended this hotel for

I have stay overnight only. At reception desk there were two receptionists and took them ages to check us in. Finally I was able to go to my room, and rush down for the dinner: few slices of ham and cheese 4200 naira (1$=155 naira cca) pasta with basil and tomato plus water 3900 naira, total of 8100 way to much for what you get.  Room was decent size but bathroom was kind of dirty, with mould growth in bath corners. I left next morning, grab breakfast before I have left (decent variety).  To sumerise, not a Sheraton level

Review Title: Decent but lower quality than expected Sheraton
Review Text: We stayed in this hotel for three days with my colleagues. It is a decent hotel with good wireless and a few dining options. Breakfasts are fine. However the hotel rooms and furnitures are old and lower quality than any Sheraton I ve seen. It is very expensive btw. But I was generally happy with my stay.

I attended a two-day conference here. The facility was good, parking was adequate, prompt service, impressive and courteous staff, the pastries were good too. I always thought there was  off about the toilets though. Needs to smell better.

There may be better hotels in Lagos, but this one is very close to the airport (depending on traffic its a 15-30 minute drive to the international terminal). That of course causes a little bit of noise, but I don't think you'll find a quiet spot anywhere in Lagos. Security is good, all vehicles are checked upon entering the premises, there is a massive fence around the hotel and the building is 20-30 meters from the road. There are security guards at the elevator in the lobby and during the night on all floors. Rooms are a bit outdated, the a/c is not too noisy but smells mouldy. Bathrooms need a renovation. Internet throughout the hotel is good and stable, also quite fast. Staff is very friendly, but sometimes orders get lost. Especially at the pool bar when at a table with a

Review Title: Very Good among the ones on Main Land
Review Text: The Best thing About it is that its close to the Airport so very convenient if your engagements are on the Mainland, saves a lot of trouble with the Lagos traffic. Food is better than other places and the rooms are comfortable and good. The reception area needs to be better planned to handle the rush as sometimes the airline crews also use the hotel. The landscaping need to be better maintained for ambiance. Pool is well maintained. You have a variety in choice among restaurants- so lot of options.

Review Title: Nice hotel just in a bad place
Review Text: Ok so obviously I went to this hotel only for business reasons as I would go to a million other places for vacation before here.  But the hotel was actually very nice and I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel stay.  Rooms were well furnished, food was edible, beer was cold and the pool was well maintained.  Staff was helpful when needed as well.  So there was a sketchy moment during the stay where I woke up and the connecting door to the room next to us was open.  Nothing was taken from my room but the erie feeling of someone possibly being in your room can freak you out.  Also we warned not to use any credit cards even in the hotel due to the theft and use of the numbers is so rampant.  The airport is a disaster as is traffic to.  There is also a Department of State warning

Review Title: Good option only if you have to avoid VI/Ikoyi
Review Text: Located very close to Airport . This saves a lot of time specially during rush hours . If you have to use Lagos as a transit point for domestic travel or if you have work towards Ikeja or outside Lagos - this is best place . You avoid traffic - go slow .  They need to change carpets on 5th floor . I was told floors up to 4th have been renovated . So next time you check in- ask for a room on lower floors . Lobby is crowded and they need to de-congest it . Breakfast was just about ok.
Review Text

While this hotel is more expensive than the Protea across the street, it has more restaurants to choose from.  It is close to the airport, in fact many flight crews stay here.  The out door restaurant and bar by the pool is very nice.  This hotel used to have AC problems but those seem to be fixed.

The staff make the hotel as the hotel itself is tired and in need of updating. I stayed for two weeks whilst working in Lagos. My room was dominated by the size of the TV. I would have had to sit in the corridor to watch it. ( Strange observation but it shows a lack of thinking) .  Food was good with a range of places to eat. The Italian restaurant was very good and I enjoyed the music on Friday evenings.  The main point was that at all times I felt safe with staff being available at all times to help with travel arrangements etc.  Just needs updating it will be very good.

I hated this hotel.  It was extremely expensive and not up to worldwide standards.  I am surprised that Sheraton allows this property to keep the Sheraton name.  This is advertised as a five-star hotel.  It is not even close.  When we checked in, we were told the bathrooms had just been remodeled.  I found out that remodeling consisted of bolting a piece of fiberboard over the bathroom sink's exposed pipes.  The gym was less than adequate, and the buffet meal was sorely lacking.    The staff seemed friendly and were always smiling, but other than that, this hotel was really disappointing.

Hotel staff were friendly, however check in took excessively long, and check out was ridiculously painstakingly long.   The hotel room had two twin sized beds- a bit unusual, but OK. The room was clean and tidy. The electricity was somewhat unreliable. The pool area was nice, neat, and appeared safe.  The hotel lobby was very warm, humid, and musty.   The staff at the bar will rip you off- best to pay when you order and do so in Nigerian currency.   Definitely NOT a place to vacation, and tolerable for a business overnight. Between the excessive room charge and added fees, the hotel should have included much more gratuitous services. I guess that's the price to pay for safety though.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton Lagos Staff are excellent- I think it's in their nature to be polite as they so veryolite! The pool is also excellent and so is the food I know they are doing major renovation work but it didn't I pact me at all I'd strongly recommend this hotel

Review Title: The hotel you wish you never stayed at ....
Review Text: Is this really a Sheraton hotel???? If so, I would like to know what is their excuse to have a hotel in such a state. Is it because is Africa? Because is Nigeria? Sorry it's not good enough! You would never find a Sheraton hotel with these poor standards in Europe or the US, you should be ashamed to downgrade your normally excellent brand keeping a hotel like this, especially when guests pay such expensive rates. When you first walk in your immediate sensation is that you went back 30 years ago, everything looks outdated with a strong smell of damp and what is worse dirty! It's like nothing has ever had a good clean since they first open the hotel. The rooms are not much better. Extremely dark, with very noisy air conditioning, I had a connecting door and I could hear everything

I have stayed at this hotel everytime when in Lagos (3 times/year). Hotel is a bit pricy compared with what you get. Rooms could use some freshening up, same goes for the restaurants. Food is good in general, safety is ok and gym as well. Located close to the airport which is convenient looking at the chaotic traffic in Lagos.

Review Title: One of a kind in Lagos
Review Text: The Hotel actually lived up to expectations. With quality service of high professional standard, and par excellence room and restaurant service in an unusual environment, I recommend this facility anyday anytime.

Not much choice when staying in Lagos for a safe hotel ,but the pricing reflects this, make everything four times the standard price and you are half way there. The main foyer and pizza place are due a good make over, room are standard, beds are good, lots of westerns to keep you company as well as aircrews, corridors at night are security manned and you fell very safe in the compound.

Review Title: One of the better one's in Lagos
Review Text: I was on a business trip in Lagos and stayed in the hotel for extended period of time. Well appointed rooms with very comfortable beds - good sleep quality.   They have a large pool and a full size lawn tennis court for recreational activities.  I'm a vegetarian so had some trouble finding good food but the chef of the La Giara restaurant was kind enough to get me some good pizza's and fried mozzarella. Goodies (Irish Pub) again is a good place to hang out.  Staff was helpful. Overall a good place - albeit a bit expensive
Review Text

Got to stay here for just one night, while on business in Lagos.  It was rather expensive (approx USD 350+) a night, but it was my first time, and not knowing what sort of safety precautions I would need to take, the Sheraton seemed like a very safe bet.   Didn't get to explore the hotel, but had breakfast at the restaurant and it was quite a lovely spread. Front desk staff were friendly and welcoming - which was nice, especially when you arrive after a long and tiring flight!  The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. Did not have slippers or a bathrobe, as I expected, but its not a deal breaker.   I got what I wanted - a place I could count on as a safe, comfortable place in bustling Lagos.

I couldn't believe what I saw,when I friend of mine gave me a call to meet him there.I've been hearing of Sheraton Hotel in Ikeja but I've not been there,but as soon as I set my eyes on d place,it was an amazing place to be.they've got a good services,wonderful structure,comedy zone relaxation spot,where you meet people that entertains you,and their meal is so delicious.But that's not a new thing in Africa concerning having a good meal,they're blessed by God for that.I really had my fun,and I'm even longing to be there again.

the brand sheraton evokes a certain awe and hence high expectation.but alas it was not the best of hotels.check in was inefficient but can be understood because we were a big group.it was highly expensive for the services it offered.may be because of the monopoly it holds in the area near to the airport. outlets were okay. rooms are strictly okay.breakfast was good though.pretty much old world hotel. the swimming pool was very good. staffs were very friendly but untrained.security in this part is very important and they scored well here.i was impressed when they stopped me in the porch with a food parcel brought from outside. they have a zero tolerance policy in this and thats very assuring .

We only spent a night here;arrived in the night and left next morning so didn't have time to explore the hotel.But the much i saw was nice enough,which is not surprising;Sheraton is supposed to be a '5 star' hotel,right?Nice grounds,nice location and warm reception by concierge...didn't expect less.. Our room was spotless,32 inch TV,big writing desk,comfy bed,powerful AC,spotless bathroom with toiletries.I had expected a mini bar,bathrobe,slippers but there was none;in a '5 star' hotel?When we ordered dinner it arrived complete with a trolley,flowers and all,nice touch!The downside is that the menu was badly limited,very little to choose from...but when our order came,it was delicious. All in all,Sheraton is...well,nice but overpriced.

The staff at this hotel are the worst. They all need to be completely retrained. The are at best civil. They are slow checking you out and slow checking you in. They have this air of disdain about them and are certainly not welcoming. Double check your bill also because things appear that you may not have signed for. The room staff are noisy and don't seem to be bothered about chatting loudly in the corridors. Review Text: I regularly stay at this hotel in Lagos because I am guaranteed a warm welcome, a great nights sleep in a really comfortable bed and it is in a central location. In a city that is renowned for expensive hotels this has to be the worst value for money.  Rather take travel a little further and stay at the Federal Palace or the Radisson which are worlds apart from this hotel and charge very similar rates.

Review Title: NEEDS AN UPGRADE BUT EXCELLENT SERVICE
Review Text: I stayed two weeks at this hotel and I have to say that they have amazing staff...always helpful, always trying to sort things out if they go wrong, and always have a smiling greeting for you day or night.  The lobby and public areas need a major facelift - their old and worn - but the rooms are fine - although TV's need upgrading.  Beds are big and there's space.  Bathrooms are also a bit dated but all in all this is a very good hotel, with great room service menu and restaurants, and tremendous staff.  The Business Center is very well equipped as well.  Would stay here vs. others.

This is home away from home,beautiful hotel i wish i could take a trip now Nigeria that will be very nice,i really want feel that tranquility of africa once again.the best time to enjoy this country is the harmattan season when everywhere is very dry and windy.

Unfortunately I have recently made a return visit through work and nothing has changed,  this hotel is a disgrace.  The photos that I have posted go someway in showing how dirty the room was.  In fact I asked a colleague to come and see it only to be informed that there room was the same.  The constant reassurances claim that room renovations are in progress seems to be false.  This place needs to be shut down, fumigated and completely gutted.  As mentioned in a previous review service is Ok however sitting outside in the pool bar (I was the only Customer) I waited 20 minutes before I went up to the waitress and asked if they were open,  she informed that they were but for drinks only,  I only wanted a coffee which when it arrived 15 minutes later was cold.

I stayed here with work for a couple of nights- this hotel should not have Sheraton written above it! The rooms are old fashioned the TV had 3 channels, the taps were leaking, bed side lamps didn't work, hairs in the bath... I could go on! I had several strange phone calls to my room which I thought was odd.  When I got back to the UK my clothes smelt of the hotel - absolutely disgusting. Very expensive too.

I thought that great ‘Nigerian Scam’ was something on the internet, and that you got conned out of your money for a being a little naive and greedy. Now I know that it is probably more likely to refer to the hotels in Lagos and those of us naive enough to believe in value for money.   I booked at the Sheraton Hotel because I had been staying at Sheratons for decades without complaint and was advised by colleagues and other contributors to Trip Advisor that it was a ‘good choice near the airport’ and the ‘best choice in Lagos’.  But what a dump!! And it’s an introduction to purgatory if you are non-smoker. The rooms are terrible, drab and basic. Review Title: The nearest choice for luxury in Lagos !
Review Text: One of the best choices for Lagos, not quite the normal Sheraton standard but then this is Nigeria.  Very friendly staff from the vivacious Lady that greets you on arrival in a form of national dress and all the other staff including the security guard on each floor.   Some rooms have been renovated and are far superior to the older rooms. The Starwood Preferred Guest floor was far superior to the others. Plenty of choices to relax in the large lobby bar area or Goodies snug English style pub or even the attached night club for late night drinking and music.   Reasonable wi-fi or ethernet throughout.   Occasional power cuts and on one visit no water for 5 hours! A clear choice amongst airline crew as this location is used by all the major carriers, so that alone testifies to the

I stayed here for a week for a business trip.   Renovated rooms are fine (clean with enough space and confort). Yes, as you can read in some other reviews, this is not your regular european/american Sheraton, but it is certainly the best choice in Lagos: near the airport, efficient and nice staff, variety of food and most important is the safest place to stay.  Prices are high, yes but you got to see this Sheraton as a business hotel (flying crews, and almost all companies send their staff to this hotel), so maybe not the best choice for a tourist experience.  Yes, sometimes lights go off, yes, sometimes A/C stops working and yes wifi is not the most stable I have used. But, this happens everywere in Nigeria, at least the staff will act always with a big smile to help you, guide

Review Title: A good choice near the airport
Review Text: Stayed for a couple of weeks, as my business was in the mainland, rather than Victoria island. A decent although dated hotel, with very friendly service.  Meeting facilities are very basic, and stay was very expensive.   A good choice if you must be near the airport.

The Sheraton in Ikeja, is a very expensive hotel and the food is just above poor to average. However, the staff are great as is the location. It does need investment to bring it up to a modern hotel and it is a shame that this is not done. However, I go there four times a year, so something most drag me back

The staff is indeed good, so is the food, and wi-fi is available in the rooms and the lobby. But the hotel is terribly over-priced and smells terribly musty. As it happens I came to the hotel, on my first visit to Lagos, from the Pretoria Sheraton, which is far superior in cost (much lower) and standards (much higher). They ought to get rid of the carpet whose smell almost knocks you as you Coe to the rooms and in the first night I could hardly sleep.

The staff was very helpfull when requesting a room with a king size bed. This was due to travelling with a small child. They were more than happy to accomadate with this request. The AC has been fixed and you better sleep under a blanket because how well it works. I would recommend this hotrl to anyone traveling to Lagos and have business on the mainland.

Every staff member I ran into, from the doorman to the maintenance man walking down the hall greeted me with a smile and a very warm greeting. The hotel is an oasis in the middle of one of the worst and most dangerous places on earth. The hotel is in surprisingly good shape for such a country. They claim the A/C is fixed and indeed it worked really well during my visit. Also, there is now free internet (wired) in every room. Cleanliness was not a problem. The food is expensive, because they know they "own" you and you are in Nigeria - you are lucky to have food! If you do not have black skin, do NOT go outside the guarded hotel grounds. I have stsyed at this hotel many times over the years (25). It does not get any better.  At present the a/c is not working in my room and in the lobby. It is 26* and Mosquitos are about.  The rooms have laminated wood floors, old style tv. No wi fi and the charges for it are really expensive through wired connection. Review Title: Horrible but at least the AC worked
Review Text: I am amazed this hotel manages to maintain its Sheraton branding, if it where a watch I'd say it was a very cheap knock off.  The staff are incredibly friendly but that is where the positives end. At first look everything seems clean but a sharper look around the edges and the rooms are covered in dust and grime. I was afraid to plug anything into the sockets as they did not instill confidence with their dodgy wiring and the bathrooms likewise did not seem sufficiently clean.  This hotel has had some sort of remodelling done recently but it is hard to tell where exactly although the beds are much better then they used to be. Very dated decor pretty much throughout; guest rooms are more modern, though bathrooms have a very 80s feel.  Breakfast buffet adequate (including Bloody Mary station which could have been interesting if not on business).  Well located for airport so lots of cabin crews who contribute to very busy vibe in lobby area.

Hotel has no a/c at present, been the case for over a week. Rooms unbearable, fans not helping just push hot air around. As no a/c lots of mosquitoes. Hotel generally grubby. Bar and lobby frequented by local prostitutes. There are better choices now in Lagos. We checked out and stayed at the Protea which was nice.

Review Title: SURELY OVERPRICED FOR THE SERVICE AND FACILITY
Review Text: I have stayed at this hotel for the past 6 years. I can really call a couple of the staff by name.  Generally, the hotel provides the best security that I know of, and it is for this reason that my organization normally chooses it for our business travel. The other plus is that the bed is quite good and the staff are usually very friendly. In terms of food, the hotel provides quite good menu, especially of the local dishes. There are a number of significant negatives though.  I find the hotel to be highly overpriced. They could charge as much as $450-500 or more for a standard room with no breakfast! Even with my UN ID and SPG Gold status, I often pay more than $380 for a night. I have on several Passions told the front desk staff that I travel around the Continent, but SHERATON

Review Title: One of the better hotels in Nigeria
Review Text: Staff were excellent and so attentive; breakfasts are very good indeed; restaurants can be a bit expensive but the food is nice; my room on the fourth floor was excellent. Really appreciated the free wifi in the room and lobby.

Review Title: Very tired product for the price paid
Review Text: This was one of the most awful experiences I have ever had in a hotel. Granted, Lagos is not a place you would expect great hotels as it is not a touristic destination, but the hotel itself is old and for the amount we paid, it was far, far away from expected. Service breakfast was not bad at all as all ladies were very friendly, and I did feel safe in the hotel (which is very important in Nigeria, of course) although all security people carrying guns right in front of the lobby. I guess my main point is that the product is tired and needs urgent renovation. I have been to several countries in the world and despite understanding that it was in Nigeria, Sheraton as a brand should be more aware of their product limitations and work with investors to get it fixed for guests that

Just returned from another work trip and this place seems to have got worse.  The Bathroom appeared dirty with cracked tiles and some dubious stains on the wall around the toilet.  There were hairs in the bath tub suggesting that cleaning is of a poor standard.  Next to the bed was a wiring loom that had been wired into the back of the plug socket meaning that the socket plate was very loose on the wall (dangerous).  Lamp shades on the lights were very dirty and stained and the overall appearance was extremely poor.  Maybe because of safety issues in Lagos  this hotel has become complacent but it is definitely unlike any Sheraton that I have stayed in before.  Overall the Hotel is tired and dated and is in desperate need of a complete refurb with rooms taking priority.
Disgusting, filthy, deplorable. My dogs rear end is cleaner than this feces hole. Stay home.

Rooms+bathrooms are dirty:dust,hair,rubbish under the bed...come on SHERATON DO SOMETHING, there are many new hotels in Lagos,will not recommend this one.Food::ordered spaghetti Bolognese and I was sick,hygiene should be priority number 1.DOES ANY ONE CARE ??Does anyone from Sheraton check this hotel sometimes ???

As a flight attendant I have stayed in more hotels around the world than I care to count. Unfortunately this one ranks as one of my least favourite! It is very tired and dated, in need of a full renovation and refresh. It is, however, better than it was a few years ago and hopefully will continue to improve.   There are a number of other issues which also need to be resolved: Power cuts - too frequent and unnecessary Internet - 7000 Naira (£30) for 24 hours in the room is way too expensive for any hotel. I turned on the shower and it seemed as if thick coffee was coming out of the shower head.  I had to run to get my camera because I've never seen anything like this before.  It got me thinking...HUM what do they wash their dishes with? Knock on wood I haven't gotten sick....YET.  The dinner Buffet and Breakfast Buffet were actually delicious. Perfect Hotel, Top service, perfect location. The staffs ( Restaurant, Front desk, Guest Service etc. )  were very friendly.A very rich Breakfast Buffet with fresh fruits.Free Internet asses at the Lobby.Very attentive service from all the staffs and we loved the free water in the room. My two daughters felt really at home. Sheraton Lagos is always a place to be.

Review Title: In terrible need of an upgrade, unlees you are on the executive floors
Review Text: Thankfully I did not have to pay for this one night stay.  It was on the executive floors, very plush, excellent level of service and lovely room, but for a price that is more than a good London hotel.  It is expensive no doubt and I would not have stayed if it was coming from my travel budget!  Food was ok, but nothing fantastic, the staff in other parts of the hotel were not as well versed in etiquette and service as was given on the executive floors, very much an us and them hotel frankly.

Review Title: Dated hotel over priced encashing the brand name
Review Text: The hotel is clearly over the hill and has lost its prime status. Peeling paint, mouldy bathrooms, non functioning airconditioning and bad service are its main attractions. To top it, the pricing which leave one feeling completely cheated.  If you have to stay at a 5 Star near the Airport, try the brand new IBIS or the Protea bang opposite the Sheraton. They are good properties and offer excellent services.

Ok. Let me start by saying that if you are a  vegetarian, there is almost nothing for you to eat here except one thing - pizza, but this is pretty disgusting pizza. They put easy singles for the cheese, tinned mushrooms, the base is thick + rubbery and has a weird taste, the taste is just not good. A little dab of tomato puree is all that substitutes for tomato. I heard from my meat eating companions on my last trip that thire food was just ok. When you get a coffee they accompany it with a cookie which has that same weird taste as the pizza base - I can't identify it, it tastes like a chemical. Thankfully I was only here for 3 nights because I couldn't stomach anymore of that pizza. The price of the pizza is outrageous, its something like 3000 naira for the vegetarian option

What that means is that you always pay more here than you would elsewhere, and -- judged purely by what the same money buys in safer places -- it always seems that you've paid too much.  I went back to the Sheraton after using one of the Proteas several times, because it was convenient for where I needed to be. I'll probably use it again next time because I enjoyed it. The hotel is old and shows it, but the service is first class and the food isn't bad. I stayed in a Club Room and had a ham and cheese breakfast in the Club Lounge (included in the price). Review Title: Dated Facility but Great Customer Service
Review Text: This is definitely not one of the newer Sheratons. The hotel has seen a lot of travelers in its day but we were welcomed at the front door in a very kind a and courteous manner. As there was a delay at the check-in counter due to a large group of flight attendants, we were escorted up to the club floor where we were checked in promptly.  We were there only one night so tried the Italian restaurant. The food was very hot and delicious and served in a timely manner. They also had an Indian Restaurant and a Buffet as options.  The room was acceptable, clean but somewhat dated. My only complaint was the internet service which was costly and slow. Review Title: Place where you feel at home when out of home.
Review Text: Lovely Hotel, dedicated staff that are fully customer focus. Customer satisfaction comes first at Sheraton Lagos.

The Sheraton Hotel is located near the airport. The hotel has a very good security standard. The hotel is run by excellent Austrian management. The food in every restaurent is very delicious.Also be mentioned is the good laundry services.If you stay here frequently you are treated like a family member.
Excellent  location Friendly staff Good restaurant Nice & clean pool and gym

There is good news and bad news: good news: rooms appear to be updated with wood floors and new bed/bedding. Rooms are fair sized and equipped with small frig, work desk, flat screen TV, the usual amenities. Bath water pressure is good and the water hot. The room was quiet for sleeping. There is a large pool with a nice pool area and shady pool bar.  The workout room is airconditioned and well equipped with equipment that works. Review Title: Convenient, but not up to par
Review Text: The best part about the Sheraton is its proximity to the international airport (although it may still take you 45 minutes to make the 5-7 mile trip).  The worst part about it is the exploitative price.  The rooms are adequate since they replaced the musty carpet with hard flooring.  The Italian Place inside the hotel has decent food, and the breakfast buffet is acceptable.  The problems, however, are many.  Internet service is so slow you can’t use Skype.  There is basically no maintenance or permanent addressing of problems. Review Title: I cannot wait to visit this hotel again!
Review Text: The staff were very friendly. Every time I passed a staff member in the lobby, hallways, reception, etc, they were all very helpful and they all asked if they can do anything special for me. The concierge and the guest service agent gave me realöly good tips of what I should do on my trip. The restaurant was excellent. The hotel is in the middle of the city. This was perfect, because I could explore the entire city by foot. Our room was very nice, modern und clean.  I cannot wait to visit this hotel again!

Unlike the previous review, I found my room clean and welcoming. The staff were fantastic, the public spaces easy to negotiate. It had a high ratio of staff to guests, so service was quick, the bars and restaurants, had an international menu, along with local dishes for the brave. I can honestly say that i enjoyed my stay and have no hesitation in recommending the Sheraton in Lagos to any traveler. It was an oasis of calm in a chaotic city

This is the dirtiest hotel that I have ever stayed in! The bed sheets had hairs on them. The lampshade was filthy, the electrical sockets were an inch thick with dust, the bathroom floor was very dirty, the sink and bath were stained and the bathroom walls had suspicious brown marks on them!

Review Title: One of the greatest hotels in Africa - really!
Review Text: If guests at the Lagos Sheraton had ANY appreciation of the day-to-day nightmare of living and running an hotel in Nigeria they would realise that the Sheraton is nothing less than a miracle. Yes, it's dated, brown, scruffy in places, sometimes smells musty, but the food is excellent thanks to the American head chef, who takes huge pride in his kitchen and his staff. They serve some outstanding steaks and seafood and the variety they manage in such difficult circumstances is remarkable. Hygiene has improved a lot since some bad experiences in past years and even the salads are okay to eat. A most welcoming hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Nothing was too much of a hassle for the staff and one was always greeted with politeness and a smile! Felt very much at home in this hotel. Great outdoor restaurant by the pool with a fantastic African feel to it and most enjoyable live music and good food! Thank you to all for making us feel very welcome!

Review Title: Surprisingly pleasant with ver good if rather quirky service
Review Text: I stayed here for one night on Valentine's Night as it so happened and was very pleasantly surprised. Having read the reviews about how awful the rooms are I was delighted to find myself in a refurbished room on the Starwood Preferred Guest Floor. The hotel is a hive of activity and particularly so as it was Valentine's Day and there were lots of locals queueing to pay for the buffet/dance function that the hotel had organised by the pool. As I was alone I elected for a quiet meal for one in the Italian restaurant and the service and food was very pleasant. Nigerians can sometimes some across as being surly but if you show them a smile they warm to you immediately. I have oscillated between Lagos and Abuja this year. The ambience of the Sheraton is still maintained. Things are hard. Times are difficult. Circumstances are tough. Paying US$370/night is on the very high side. I stayed in a two-bedroom flat in DOHA for US$130/night. This is an area that must be revisited and very quickly.  For me, every other thing worked. Some challenges about Gold and Platinum Card holders, but that was normal. SHERATON is still the hotel of first choice in IKEJA!!!

Review Title: The very worst hotel I have ever stayed at.
Review Text: On arrival, the staff were PAINFULLY slow checking us in. The room I was allocated was tired, old and the air conditioning didn't work. Despite me trying to explain this so the maintenance engineer twice, he couldn't have been less interested. Lighting in the room was intermittent, the bathroom floor was filthy, there was a used condom under the bed, the mini bar was very noisy, so I had to unplug it. Two of the three plug points in the room didn't work and had exposed wiring. No toiletries were provided and I had to phone reception to ask for a bar of soap to wash my hands.   Throughout my stay the staff took an age to do anything and showed no interest in gues satisfaction at all.   Internet access obviously didn't work as advertised, so don't waste your time trying. Review Title: Overpriced, musty dated rooms - don't waste your time!
Review Text: I recently stayed at this hotel and was really disappointed with the overall experience. Completely overpriced for what you get. Infact, I would go as far to say that the price that I was charged was ridiculous. The corridor to the room smelt of must as did the carpets in the room that I was allocated. The check-in process was painful with the receptionist completely disinterested. He was simply there to take the money and nothing else. The room service was very slow but at least edible. The overall experience was not what one expects from a Sheraton hotel, so please avoid this hotel unless you have no other option.

Review Title: Very friendly reception. Rooms a little tired, but acceptable.

The room was a little tired and the bedside radio and light array was broken, with wires coming out. The carpet felt unclean and a bit tacky underfoot, but the room was peaceful and I njoyed a good rest. I ate there for one of my nights, but the waitress couldnt get a grasp of my order. Review Title: This is a wonderful home away from home
Review Text: The great exerience commences from the moment you walk through the doors of the Sheraton. The warmness of the guest staff is most welcoming and they're very gifted in taking away the stress of having taken a long journey.  The food is always delicious, and plentiful  whether served in one of their superb restaurants or room service. The work out facilities are always clean, well staffed and equipment in perfect condition.  As for the rooms I have never slept so much and so peacefully as I do on the comfortable mattresses in my room.  The rooms are always clean and the staff always willing to accommodate if anything is needed.  I love the close proximity to the airport and the security is by far the best.  I love my hostesses when I enter the lobby for their warm and welcoming

Review Title: Such variable quality for so much money!
Review Text: I stay at the Sheraton somewhere between 3 and 5 times a year for the last few years and each visit seems to be to a different hotel, although it's been mostly good (a few great stays even) the last couple of years. On this last trip, I was on an overnight stay transiting Lagos. There seemed to have been some overbooking so some discussion between check in staff, then I was "upgraded" to a room on the club floor. The musty smell hit me at the door but after a whole day travelling, I was not in the mood of arguing for a room change. So I went in. The room was from the early 90's, the TV from earlier. Room service, which is usually good, was mediocre that day, same with breakfast the next morning in the lounge. The smell of that room went home with me! So I am again trying to find

This hotel underwent a makeover about a couple of years ago and improved dramatically. Now, however, the signs of wear and tear are beginning to show. My bathroom looked tatty with a bath that needed re-enamelling, the floor tiles worn and a stained toilet bowl. My bedroom on the third floor was better with wood flooring and a comfortable bed with good linens. Internet access in the room is very expensive. It is free in the lobby but so, so slow. The pool area is pleasant, the food good but expensive and the staff very, very friendly. I just hope that Sheraton do not let the hotel deteriorate back to where it was before the makeover. I would recommend this hotel as I know that finding good accommodation in Lagos is hard and the Sheraton is safe and friendly.

Review Title: Great Hotel near Airport in Lagos
Review Text: Very comfortable hotel with fantastic welcoming guest relations headed by the wonderful Maria. Takes the stress out of the journey. Good food variety - BBQ Nights, Italian, Fish, Nigerian, Buffet , Bar food all watched over by chef Bill.  Comfortable beds and rooms. I'll be back !

Sheraton Lagos/Ikeja is very conveniently situated near the airport and to Oshodi and Ijeka business places. Compared to other Lagos hotels the staff is extremely helpful, friendly and reliable. Service and guest relationship is extraordinary. The infrastructure at the hotel is very good and it makes it a good place for a Solo Traveller considering that Ijeka is not the best and safest place on earth to go out at night on your own. There is a good variety of food with good quality in different restaurants. The pool and the pool bar area and a small gym are nice places to relax, although the neighbourhood in Ikeja is always a little bit loud. The rooms are well equipped for a business traveller, the size is ok, bathroom is clean, could need some renovation however.

Review Title: The place I am looking forward to returning to
Review Text: This was my first visit to the Sheraton and in fact to Nigeria but the welcome I received made me begin to doubt the adverse comments I had heard about the country and it.s people. On arrival I received a wonderful welcome by a beautifully attired lady called Marie Pinder, she could not have been more welcoming and she continued to be so for the whole of my stay. I was checked in by a very helpful and efficient lady called Yowendee who organised a welcome drink for me. Between these two young ladies they  made the tedious task of checking into a hotel a complete pleasure, they are excellents ambassadors for you. The Sheraton in Lagos provides a extensive range of facilities to the traveler; from the wide range of restaurants, bars, shops, sports facilities and even a night club.

Review Title: Courteous and friendly staff make you feel welcome in a cosy environment.
Review Text: Sheraton Lagos is my top pick for leisure and business in Lagos because of its close proximity to the International Airport, excellent catering, relaxing environment and sleep experience (the beds are top notch in pillow-soft comfort). To top it all, the courteous and friendly staff are always doting on you to ensure that nothing mars your Sheraton experience. If you are looking for a place to get value for your money in Lagos, Sheraton Lagos is your surest bet.

Lagos Sheraton is an oasis of tranquillity & welcome respite from the challenging traffic & Lagos conditions. The staff are well trained & very friendly, from the moment you walk into the entrance lobby the excellent Guest Relations team make you feel very welcome - usually led by Maria's smiling face.  I've been a frequent business visitor to Lagos for a long time, and over the past 2 years the quality of service at the Sheraton has improved enormously, as has the quality of the excellent food. All credit to the management & staff - Nigeria is a tough operating environment & they have proved they can compete on an international level. I stayed at the Sheraton at the end of a medical mission trip in August 2000.  It was a welcome respite compared to the conditions under which we lived in the Anambra State.  However, the prices were very high and we were charged more since we were non Nigerian.  That seemed to be customary business.  The hotel service was actually pretty good and we did enjoy the meals we had, as well.  We played tennis and even had ball boys!  All in all, the hotel was just average for the price we paid but still worth it to have air conditioning and running water.

Review Title: Professional and friendly guest services staff
Review Text: I have stayed several times at the Sheraton on business trips. The hotel offers a wide range of dining and entertainment options. Feels like an oasis in the rough and tumble of Lagos. Guest services staff in general and Maria in particular, go above and beyond the call of duty to make sure guest feel welcome and satisfied.

Review Title: Great welcome from all on arraval
Review Text: The hotel is very good with warm welcoming staff. Rooms are neat and clean with the sweetsleeper bed - very comfortable. They have a special greet and welcoming staff called"guest Relations with a  very intelligent manager - Maria. These people really make me feel I am entering a family at the Sheraton Lagos. This is definately the place to be.

I have been traveling sround Africa since 2003. When I first went to the Sheraton in Lagos I was not impressed by the way i was dealt with - it was all ablout money money money I am glad to say that has all changed now - They have people(led by lovely Maria) who welcome you and do everything possible to make your Lagos trip pleasureble The hotel boast several resteraunts but the Italian is top class - try the Minestrone soup and the Lasagne The rooms that have been refurbished are fantastic and to make you welcome SPG members get wine or fruit on arrival

Review Title: The best customer care I've encountered in Africa
Review Text: As a regular business visitor to Lagos this is always my hotel of choice. The rooms have been tastefully and practically modernised and the beds are supremely comfortable. The broadband is reliable and fast and any self-inflicted problems with my PC have been cheerfully and swiftly resolved by the IT department. The restaurants and food are varied and appetising.  The location is very handy for the airport, though far enough not to be disturbed by the noise,  and very convenient for business connections on the 'mainland'.  All the staff - and I do mean all - make it their personal responsibility to ensure we have the best they can give us, and they make it seem like their pleasure, not their job.

The Sheraton Lagos have improved tremendously within the past 9 months as far as Food, Service, Internet and cleanliness. It's a bit expensive but their security and location is perfect. Like hotels all over the world, you must renovate from time to time.I found that the bathrooms & rooms were clean but just a bit worn for the money that I paid. I would certainly reccommend it to my friends knowing that their stay in Lagos would be the safest and the food would be tasety with plenty of choices

Review Title: Great Hotel, safe, clean and friendly
Review Text: The Sheraton lagos is the safest place to stay in lagos, clean with incredible freindly staff! a good choice!

Review Title: The best and safest in the Area
Review Text: I stayed here several times with my Colleages and we are happy to stay at this Place .The Rooms are clean,the Personal is friendly and helpful all around the clock.I would prefer this Hotel for my next Stays in Lagos
the guest relations officer MARIA PINDAR is a very nice lady and i giv here 10 points

Review Title: If this is the best...what is the worst
Review Text: First time in Lagos and i booked here. It was very humid yet the room i was given did not have AC. The management were not moved by my comments and the check in clerks even had the audacity to ask me for more than what i had been quoted. Whatever happened to hospitality in Nigeria. Rude Staffs, inconsiderate to guests and rough talking to the guest. If you stay here do so at your own peril
Nice hotel , it feels safe and staff is friendly ...not happy with the food but swimming pool is quite nice

Like other reviewers I think this is the best hotel in Lagos avaialable.Compared to other Sheraton Hotels around the world this is a world apart.Surly staff,very dated lobby,my room was OK though bathroom was dated and water from shower a brownish colour!Person I was travelling with had a room on a floor below which hadnot been renovated and was terrible and had/was a smoking room.Food EXTREMELY over priced and of POOR quality.The room service I had was pretty laughable!Small bar busy think with airline crew.Pool area OK though swimmimg pool looked like it need cleaned as had oil slick of sunoil over the top.Could not wait to get out of the place.Terrible!

Review Title: best hotel in the city, but...
Review Text: supposedly this is the best hotel in the city. my room was nice, and fairly newly remodeled. the bed was comfortable. although other colleagues that stayed on the 2nd floor said their rooms were in less than desirable condition. (smelled of smoke, old carpet, etc). the hotel staff were friendly and accomodating. the gift shops however, have the reputation of trying to rip you off if you don't know better. the breakfast buffet, restaurants, and bar are wonderful, but expensive. the best idea here is to charge everything to your room and pay out with your own currency at check out as there are exorbitant exchange fees. also, take cash - don't use credit cards. i felt safe in this hotel, but would not readily venture outside of it without an experienced and trustworthy local guide.

A good hotel as the brand name Sheraton says. But compared to other sheraton hotel worldwide, it needs to improve its standard. But definitely a good one. The renovated rooms are very good, but not the old ones.

Review Title: Not very nice and simply overpriced!
Review Text: I stayed at this hotel during my business trip to Lagos, 4nts.... I had stayed here on a previous trip to Nigeria a couple of years ago and I was amazed to see things have not "improved" here!! Staff at the bar and restaurants - as well as porters, cleaners and security are friendly and courteous - but the same cannot be said about the reception staff. I appreciate it is always very busy, however I dont like people with attitude. This time I felt the buffet food at the main restaurant just got worse, but room service I ordered twice (sandwich and burguer) was surprisingly tasty and good portions.

I have stayed in this hotel several times and have found it to be a fairly decent place. I have nothing to compare it to in Nigeria but all in all I have no complaints. The hotel isn't far from the airport and seems busy whatever time of year. The rooms are ok and some have been refurbished and have a kettle and coffee maker. The bathrooms are a bit tired still but the showers are powerful and I have never had a problem with hot water.  The gym has enough to keep you occupied and there is also a tennis court where you can have lessons. The pool area is pleasant and there is a dining area if you want to eat outside. Service, like in many parts of Africa, is s..l..o..w so be sure to order before you are starving. I made this mistake once and nearly ate my placemat before my meal

I've been staying in the The Sheraton Lagos on and off for twenty years and I feel it's still the best option in town.  The staff are friendly and willing to help when the inevitable problems arise and the security is very good indeed.  The food and bar outlets are reasonable and you are not pestered with unwanted guests as in other Nigerian hotels. Service can be a little slow but that's just the way it is - get used to it and it makes life a lot easier.  The prices are very high but in my view worth it purely because of the security.  Some of the rooms are a little tired but most things usually work.   Location is good for both domestic and international airports but not so good if you are going to Victoria Island - usually a two hour slog (each way) through the traffic.

The Lagos Sheraton is known as "the place to stay" in Lagos. Unfortunately they are running a money making machine, with very limited competition, so can charge eye wateringly high rates and still fill the place every night. There are lots of airline crew in the hotel, most of the other guests are business visitors like myself.  The check in was friendly and pleasant, and relatively smooth. The rooms are acceptable, but old and in need of renovation. You would not pay $600 for this standard anywhere else. There is now internet access in the rooms (this is new apparently) which is also charged at silly prices... but what can you do?! At least the bed is comfortable and there was hot water. I have stayed here several times on business. As far as African hotels go this is by far the best I have used and it is very secure  The staff are friendly and keen to assist. The rooms are of good size, clean and well maintained. Some of the bathrooms are a bit worn round the edges.  The bar is quite lively and busy and you can have a bite to eat if you are a bit late getting checked in.  The two restaurants are very good and offer a great menu and reasonably priced.  The hotel is expensive but it’s worth paying the extra for the piece of mind.

Don't expect the same Sheraton standards that you may see in North America or in the Asia Pacific. The hotel stands out as an imposing figure amongst the surrounding buildings. The hotel has guards at the entrance for security purposes. The hotel lobby looks a little dated, but it is large and full of people. You will often see a lot of flight crew at the hotel, as it is the only hotel the airlines use.   Reception staff were courteous and I never had to wait more than 2 minutes to get served. There are security guards on every floor, always ready to greet you when you exit the elevator. All the cleaners were happy to greet you as crossed paths in the hallways. Second time at the Sheraton Lagos. Stayed on the 3rd floor in one of the recently remodled room. The problem is they forgot to remodle/update the bathrooms. Mold and stains on the tile. Not what you would expect of a Sheraton charging $300 plus per night.  But it is the only safe/secure hotel in Lagos in which to stay. You really don't have a choice . So they pretty much have a manopoly.  They do have a few nice restaurants (but expensive)  in the hotel and a nice pool area. The pool is always busy with flight crews during the day as that is about the only thing to do- sunbathe by the pool or work out in the hotel gym. You can't leave the hotel. Not safe.

Having stayed many times at this hotel I was very pleasantly surprised by how much the bedrooms had improved during my last stay. The rooms have all been refurbished with hardwood floors (noisy but clean), better beds and duvets with white linen. I actually looked forward to going to bed rather than feel disgusted by the linen as I have in the past. The bathrooms, unfortunately, have not been refurbished and discolored water is still the norm.  TV's have been replaced and all other furniture is new.  The Lobby is still the same and check-in is still slow. Restaurants serve adequate food and the pool area is still a little tired.  This hotel is still the best in Lagos and so will continue to charge high prices for mediocre service.

If you arrive in the evening, one of the first things you may see are the prostitutes standing in front of the hotel, offering their services to Western businessmen.  You can expect a variety of incompetence from all aspects of the hotel staff. From being checked-in to maid service. The checking-in process can take hours. This is completely ridiculous when compared to checking into a hotel in the U.S. or Europe. In fact, everything in Lagos can take forever. The traffic in the city is horrible and what may take you a half hour to accomplish in the U.S., in Lagos it can take all day.  If you choose to eat in the restaurant downstairs, you'll find that the food is rather bland. By the end of your stay, no matter where you eat, you will be dying for Western food.  Expect to be

The Sheraton is reputedly the best hotel in Lagos; given the state of Lagos, that makes sense. My room was "tired" and the decor outdated. The bathroom floor was cracked and dirty. The bathroom door was filthy. The room - in fact the whole hotel - smelled of (and was) damp. If one chanced to look under one's pillow case...well, don't! Carpets in hall were filthy but rooms had laminate flooring. Restaurant and lobby bar staff were at best indifferent althought the "typical English pub" staff were quite friendly. On the plus side, free wireless in the lobby bar was very convenient. I would not stay there again - or visit Lagos - unless absolutely unavoidable. Hopefully, the hotel's management read these reviews.

Review Title: too expensive for the service you get
Review Text: I have stayed in many hotels including BurJ Al Arab in Dubai reputed to be the only 7 star hotel in the world. Lagos Sheraton is ridiculously overpriced for the level of service you receive, the booking in procedure was lengthy and the receptionist was rude, the rooms are dodgy, I will not be going back mainly due to the prices of the rooms.

Review Title: Abolutely awful- avoid at all costs.
Review Text: Service is terrible - took two hours to check in, even though I had a booking.Ludicrously expensive for poor quality room finishes, bad service, non working airconditioning, power failures etc.

We have just returned from a stay at the Sheraton and Towers Ikeja, Lagos Nigeria. We booked our towers room (6th executive floor) through the Starwood reservation system where we were told that the rooms on that floor had been refurbished. When arriving in our room (631) it was a complete dissapointment. Tiny bathroom with cracked sink producing yellow to brown coloured water, roomdecoration from the eightie's and smelly! My guess is that they only refurbished a couple of rooms to put on their site. On the other hand, staff was very friendly and helpful throughout the hotel. Food was excellent for Nigerian standards but pricy. Beautiful pool and very relaxing lobby lounge. This is really a safe haven in a crazy city and surely the n°1 hotel in town. Review Title: Make sure to ask for a "newly refurbished room"
Review Text: As ex-air crew, I stayed many a night in this hotel. As far as hotels in Lagos go, this one is fine (although I would not want to stay here for a holiday!) It is safe as long as you stay within the hotel complex. DO NOT venture out un-escorted even to the Chinese restaurant next door as there was an armed hold-up there last year!!  There is a HUGE difference between the renovated rooms and the older ones so do try to get one of the new ones. Trust me.  The gym is good, as is the pool area. They have live entertainment a few nights a week & themed buffets by the pool.    There is a small nail bar beside the gym and they do good pedicures for about $10 US. Review Title: Great and safe hotel of you need to be in Lagos
Review Text: Needed to go to Lagos for business reasons and was glad to stay in such a decent place. Security is not an issue with officers contolling all floors at night and a big room safe for valuables. A good choice for business travellers who need reliable phone and internet connection. The restaurant and business centre are fine - but the whole deal is somewhat pricey (as all hotels in Nigeria). The closeness to the airport makes it a very good choice (althouhg it is clearly not a typical airport hotel); however, if you need to do business in the Victoria Island area it may take some time through the chaotic Lagos traffic.

The hotel was great when i stayed for the month i visited.  Even though the people in the front desk were not the most pleasant they did not have bad attitudes.  The rooms were great i thought the beds and pillows were comfortable, and the shower was runing with good clean water.  Also there was every service u look for in a hotel available internets, great food, and a beautiful swiming pool.  I also have to put extra emphasis on the chef because the food was great and very tasteful.
